Reviews.Title: “Shantell (Desk Clerk's Kindness)”
Reviews.Author: JoCyria A
Reviews.Content: I called the Holiday Inn to get a reservation for the St. Paul's School vs Lincoln High School, Tallahassee game on Friday night at 6:00 p.m., of which we(Lincoln High) won. The receptionist was a young lady name Shantell who answered my call. She had a very welcoming voice and made the reservation for me. As I was asked questions from the school (Lincoln), I called Shantell to get the answer. I called her several times and her pleasant voice was the same as it was the first time, so much so that she was able to say, Hello Ms. Acoff and we laughed about that. I thanked her for her pleasant attitude and hoped that she was going to be there when we arrived. Because she was so nice, when hurricane Issac went through New Orleans, I felt a great concern for them at the Holiday Inn that I called to find out if she was safe. When we arrived I left a package for Shantell because had been extremely helpful to me to get the information back to the school. Thanks again Shantell for ALL that you do and your kind spirit. Upon my stay I met a young lady name Juanita who was just as helpful as Shantell. Holiday Inn, if you don't know it, let me be the one to tell you that you have GEMS in these two young ladies and when I return to New Orleans, I am planning on staying at the Holiday Inn Downtown Superdome New Orleans. Continue the good work ladies.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: JerNew901
Reviews.Content: I wouls like to say that I was not expecting much from this hotel. However, when we walkes into or room, it was a great surprise to us. The room was spacious enough for us to throw a small hospitality in there (in N.O. for convention). Bed was so comfortable that i did not want to get up the next morning. The one thing that spoiled our stay a bit was the water was not hot in the shower. It was probably lukewarm at best! Other than that, we really enjoyes our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not a great location”
Reviews.Author: APMAN652
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to New Orleans for Hurricane Isaac response and stayed at the downtown Holiday Inn. Overall the hotel was very good. The rooms are comfortable and spacious. However the balcony doors need to be replaced with heavier/sound prevention doors. Each night, sirens from emergency vehicles were very loud, like I had the door open. The pool is nice, as well as, the sun deck area. The elevators are very old and need some repair and/or replacement. The location of the hotel is not very walk-able. It is several blocks to the tourist areas and those blocks contain several dark streets, construction areas and unsafe conditions. Also, we did not see any close resturants nearby. If you want to go to Bourbon street do yourself a favor and drive to that area. Again, overall the hotel was what I expected, clean rooms, and good customer service. There are several other options near the Bourbon street area and Harrahs casino but you are going to pay a lot more for those higher end hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes this hotel special”
Reviews.Author: AngelaHeath
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all the amenities one would expect from a centrally located hotel in New Orleans. It is the superior staff that separates it from others. Everyone --from Alex, Lucien, Donna, Lyshonda & Patrice at the front desk, to the wait staff in the hotel's restaurant to the cleaning ladies on the 14th floor-- treated us as if we were family and went out of their way to accommodate us during a 4 day stay due to evacuation from hurricane Isaac. My family & I cannot say enough good things about the friendly and caring service we received at this hotel and we plan to stay again during more pleasant circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kyle G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week on one of three trips to New Orleans in August, and I would rank this hotel second between the nicer Hilton Garden Inn (CBD) and the not as nice Courtyard by Marriott (Convention Center). This hotel seems dated in many ways but the rooms have been upgraded. The rooms are a little smaller compared to some of the other places I stayed in New Orleans, but they are well appointed. The biggest complaint I had while there is the elevators are very slow and make staying on a high floor a little bit of a pain (I was on 17). The lock didn't work on the fitness center and so I had to go to the front desk to get them to let me in. The hotel is close to many things, but is further away from many attractions when compared to most other options. During my stay I parked in a garage at the corner of O'Keefe and Gravier that only cost $4 a night on week nights which was a nice suprise compared to the nearly $30 a night that the Holiday Inn charges.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: jrut1
Reviews.Content: Our stay here made us feel like royalty! Alex at the desk went beyond what was needed to make sure our room was great, our questions were answered, and our stay here started out with a feeling of confidence in what our needs were. If you are going on a cruise from New Orleans, by all means start here. Great parking while you are gone. Shuttle to the dock. And great rooms a d service. Never felt more Royal!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: negroatt
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, just a few issues: One of the parking lot booth attendants didn't stop talking on her cell phone while we were trying to figure out how to open the gate with our card. She didn't even say 'hello' two days in a row $25dls a night for the parking lot? Why don't they include the parking pass in the cost of the room? The room was great. The balcony and the bathroom need an upgrade, though. Bathroom is kind of small. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “First Impressions”
Reviews.Author: Dastarksfam
Reviews.Content: I had been shopping around for a park and cruise package and I came across this location. The price and location looked great, but I needed one question answered before booking. I called the hotel directly and Lucius answered, I asked him did this location shuttle to the cruise terminal. He put me on hold and tranferred me to the Unknown. This should have been a simple question to answer. Anyway I figured if he was not competant enough to answer the question the hotel property wouldnt be to different. On to the next.........

Reviews.Title: “Second stay: even better than the first”
Reviews.Author: Vidiot42
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Downtown - Superdome last year when I was attending a convention in the French Quarter, and it was perfectly nice, standard Holiday Inn with friendly and accommodating staff. Hotwire got me a pretty good deal again for this year's iteration of the convention, and I was pleased to find that I knew the hotel from my previous stay. Since my last stay, though, the hotel has undergone a comprehensive renovation. Hallways are newly carpeted and I think painted, while guest rooms are much nicer with stylish decor and furniture (dark gray and red walls with Warhol prints!) and feel bigger. Lots of counter/desktop space, lots of electrical outlets (which most hotels don't seem to have), big flatscreen TV. There was construction outside (I believe they're putting in a new streetcar line on Loyola Street), but we didn't hear a thing. The blackout curtains certainly do darken the room: a couple times I got up and dressed in the dark because my travel companions were still asleep...and then was shocked by how bright it was when I got outside! My travel companions enjoyed the guest laundry facilities and the swimming pool, though I didn't get a chance to use either. We parked a car for our stay, and though expensive ($26.75 I believe), the convenience of not parking someplace cheaper (and having full 24/7 in & out access) was worth it. We extended our Hotwire reservation by a day because we found ourselves near the hotel earlier than we expected. That worked fine, except we had to check out and check back into the same hotel (though that took literally about thirty seconds to receive new key cards; not bad at all.) The front desk blocked off the room for the entire duration of the stay when I mentioned this, so we wouldn't have to change rooms, which we appreciated. All the staff was incredibly helpful, especially Brad at the front desk (who broke $20 bills for me a couple of times so I could take the bus/streetcar) and Oswald at the bell desk, who cheerfully helped us with our many heavy bags and gave us good restaurant recommendations besides. But I feel like I shouldn't single anyone out, since everyone was so very friendly. We had no problems during the stay, with the possible exception of needing more towels a couple times, but our requests were instantly filled. (Also, the previous occupants had left a plastic wand of soap bubbles in the room, which was left alone by the housekeepers.) The shuttle service to the cruise port would be useful if it went more places, but if you're going there I can see how it'd be very helpful. It's about a ten-minute walk to the Quarter, and while the terrain can be very quiet -- downright deserted on some blocks -- I never felt unsafe. There are 24-hour drugstores and convenience stores close to the hotel, and I was glad that our room had a fridge for storing the drinks I brought along, which were very nice to have after a long day of imbibing. At any rate, I'd unquestioningly recommend this hotel as a great value in downtown New Orleans, and one of the most consistent places I've stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: GCook
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and well kept up. Friendly, helpful staff, Comfortable room. Only two minor complaints -- couldn't get the wi-fi to work and the elevator service is very slow. Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to stay there agin.

Reviews.Title: “great value!”
Reviews.Author: totoro_26
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was a good deal-nothing too fancy, but I would definitely stay again. I went to NOLA to celebrate my 21st birthday, and stayed two nights with a group of friends. It is about a 10-15 minute walk to Bourbon street, but it wasn't bad. I walked both during the day and at 3am and nobody bothered us. I would not recommend walking alone anywhere in NOLA, but that is just me... with my friends it was fine, and even if I had to walk it alone, I doubt anything would have happened. I didn't even see any suspicious activity. Pros: comfortable beds, clean, spacious rooms, close to canal street-yet away from the noise, good price, modern look, in-room refrigerator/microwave, price (I booked on Hotwire and it was about half the cost of everything else near that area) Cons: elevators are VERY slow and there are not enough of them to service 18 floors worth of people, difficult to get special requests, pool was always filled with kids, expensive parking-$25/day (but it IS NOLA, so parking isn't going to be cheap anyhow) The only issue I had was when I first checked in and they wouldn't give me two rooms next to each other. I booked 2 rooms when I made the reservation and I had called twice before the trip and made the request for the rooms to be next to each other. They said, "sorry, we are too full to get two rooms even close together" (and they were full, but I had called several weeks and even that morning to confirm my request had been entered). Once I asked the manager, however, she was able to get my two rooms next to each other-so if you have any special requests, be prepared to stand your ground and talk to a manager. Overall, it was a great value and I am glad we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “for the money you can do better”
Reviews.Author: Tulsa33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in July. Our air conditioner was very loud and moldy and didn't work well. It took two nights of bad sleep for it to be replaced. It was truly obvious to anyone that it should have been taken care of long ago. The elevators were very slow and really put a damper on our time. The staff is constantly using the 4 elevators(usually only 3 worked), so there wasn't room for the guests. MANY times we had to wait on the 3rd or 4th elevator to come. A LOT of wasted time. The people at the front desk seem like they have heard all the complaints before and are tired of hearing it. I have stayed at many other hotels in this area without any of these problems, so why choose it?

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: TigersMom2012
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary. I negotiated for the room on price line and was initially disappointed when I realized I paid $180.00 for a room at the Holiday Inn. When we arrived I seen how clean and updated the hotel was, and how helpful and friendly the staff was. I love that there was an Andy Warhol print in the room. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again. We felt completely safe walking back to the hotel @ midnight from Bourbon st. (Which I was a bit concerned about).

Reviews.Title: “If the price is right, why not?”
Reviews.Author: Fitch7600
Reviews.Content: We got into New Orleans a night earlier than planned and had to grab a hotel for a short night's sleep. This hotel was selling for about $60 on Hotwire. For that price, it was an absolute bargain. It's a solid three star hotel, near the Superdome and within walking distance of the Quarter. It's older, or at least it feels that way. As I recall the hallways had carpeted walls. The room was decent but had an old style wall unit air conditioner and there was no happy medium on climate. If you were within a three or four foot radius of the unit, it was blasting cold, but even still the rest of the room was warm and muggy. Of course, that's more to do with the city than the AC, but it would have been somewhat unpleasant for more than a night. The bottom line is that if New Orleans is a dream destination for you, aim higher in your choice of hotel, and if you are there on business with the client paying, there are better options. If you are looking for an inexpensive place to sleep off the night, and you don't expect to be in the room much, consider the Holiday Inn as long as the rate is in double digits. You could do worse.

Reviews.Title: “Great place/Great value”
Reviews.Author: Missey B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Holiday Inn from 7/15-7/18 of 2012 while we moved our son to New Orleans. The rate was great (Priceline) and the room was so CLEAN and comfortable ! The only thing we were disappointed in was the lack of shuttle service as advertised on their site, but since we had our own car, it was not a terrible inconvience. The parking charge of $25.00 per night was reasonable when we looked at other parking fees in the area. I would absolutely stay there on the next trip to N.O. and since our son is now living there, those trips will be a certain thing for us. Don't hesitate to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in our stay during the Essence Music Festival”
Reviews.Author: Courtney M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located near the Superdome. That was the reason we decided to stay here. Unfortunately that was the only perk of staying here. Upon checking in we noted that the bathroom in our room hadn't been cleaned properly and we had to get the housekeeper to redo it. There was hair and dirt on the floor and the bathtub. Our bathroom sinks wouldn't drain properly. We asked for extra towels the next morning and we were given large towels but were informed they didn't have any more small towels. We finally got small towels later that night. On our 3rd night of staying we decided to have drinks at the bar during happy hour. Each night we noticed that the bar was under staffed and not able to keep up with the demands of the customers. Food orders were given to the wrong customers. The wait to order drinks was always too long. This night there was not a crowd at the bar but we were served our drinks in plastic drinking cups instead of glasses. The bottom line is we were very disappointed in the service and the stay at this hotel. The pictures were pretty accurate but the renovations are mainly to the interior rooms and the hallways. The rest of the hotel is still older and could use sprucing up. We would not stay here again especially for the prices. We paid $200 per night with a corporate discount. The hotel simply did not meet our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoogFan
Reviews.Content: Only thing I have to say that would be considered bad is that you have to pay for parking. Did not know (booked through Hotwire) before we booked. The overall experience more than made up for it. Fantastic room (we were put on the concerige level), great staff, and much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but lacks location”
Reviews.Author: amismom
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very clean and were cleaned thoroughly every day. I find that sometimes the maid service slacks off if you are staying for a while. Not so here. Excellent maid service. Hotel staff in general was a cut above. They were friendly, cheerful, helpful and efficient. Good food in the restaurant and fairly resonablely priced. Great grits. Drugstore close by, across from the public library. Now for the cons. The street is torn up in front for a new streetcar line. Jackhammers at 7 am including weekends! It will be great when finished as this will make the hotel location accessible to the transportation system. Right now it is a long walk. Seems manageable at first but becomes old quite quickly when everything you want to see and do is a 10-15 min walk to the trolley. No complimentary shuttle anymore evidently, as some reviewers mentioned. Too bad, right now this place needs it. Our rate specifically stated breakfast was included. Turns out that this is a coupon for 10.00 each day in the restaurant. Not free, when you are a couple or a family. Not a good surprise. Make sure that you check out the visitor websites and brochures. While we were staying there we saw that we should have asked for the "fun" rate which was considerably less than the rate which included breakfast, even considering the 10.00 breakfast coupon.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smyle5
Reviews.Content: Keeping in mind that this is a Holiday Inn, and not the Ritz, this was a nice hotel. I stayed here w/ my Grandma, Mom, and sister (all in one room!) for 4 days. The beds were very comfortable, and the cleaning staff was accomodating to the large # of people in the room after we left them a note. All the normal amenities (TV/AC/bathroom fixtures) worked fine. The hotel also had a nice rooftop pool, and a large convention center which we visited for a craft show. The hotel is a bit of a walk from the Quarter, but everyone in my group (including Grandma) made it several times a day w/out any issues and at all hours of the day w/out feeling terribly unsafe, although I don't think I would want to do the walk alone after the bars close.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tybright
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the Essence Festival. The only complaint I had was the distance to bourbon street which wasn't a big deal because it was only a 10-15 min walk away. I loved the staff during the day in the hotel they were very friendly even the maid service. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: Flseagal
Reviews.Content: We only paid $79 per night and received free parking which is usually $23 per day. The people working at the hotel were very nice and helpful. The rooms were clean and nice but were in need of some TLC. The sink was stopped up the frig was frozen up the sheets had holes the thermostat didn't work. They did try there best to fix most of it. The pool was cloudy and full of screaming kids. We left. The restaurant had decent food but my daughters salad dressing had a big bug in it!! That was the end of eating there. The location is in a run down area with many vacant buildings which can be seen from most rooms. The roads leading to the hotel are under construction which makes it very hard to get there. Be sure to call for directions. We really didn't feel very safe walking around that area with our grand kids. The streetcar is about four blocks and we would not walk to it at night. Overall I guess we probably wouldn't stay there again, but for $79 per night I feel ok about it.

Reviews.Title: “Just so so hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deborah F
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the negative reviews of this hotel and still decided to try it out. We were going to be here for two nights, but checked out the next morning after our first night. The comments about the staff here not caring were dead on. There was no guide in our room that had information on the hotel or surrounding area, and when I called the front desk they said they didn't have them and we could direct all questions to them. So I did. :( Calls about how to sign on to the internet (we were not given this info upon check-in), where laundry was/where pool was, hours. Did they do room service, even though the web states they do, front desk said they did not and they could not (or would not) recommend any restaurants that delivered. The carpets in our room had not been cleaned in I don't know how long because my small son walked around in his bare feet and they were black from the dirty carpets. That was when we decided to only stay one night. Water in the bathroom comes out in spurts from strange pressure and the air conditioning was frigid and didn't seem to be a way to get it adjusted. Definitely the worst customer service we've ever seen from staff. Save yourself some head aches and choose one of their other properties or try a different hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Gets the job done to travel in and out of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: TeddyBearFace
Reviews.Content: I would recommend The Holiday Inn Superdome to anyone visiting The Superdome or cruise port. The shuttle service and parking was included, the room was clean, and that is all we were looking for. For someone looking to enjoy The French Quarter or Bourbon St. it is close enough, but it doesn't offer the authentic atmosphere someone might be looking for in a New Orleans vacation. If you're here with plans and just need a place to sleep, the Holiday Inn Downtown Superdome is perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: dkgrapevine
Reviews.Content: had a big, beautiful room - modern art deco theme. clean, quiet. pretty easy to get to. the only potential downside (depending on your perspective, this can be an upside!) is that it is a few blocks away from the heart of the quarter.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: monique j
Reviews.Content: It was a great stay. Big rooms and good service. The A.C in our room was kind of weak. It was so hot in New Orleans. They have a gym and a Laundry Room if you need it. The Banquet food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TinaH152
Reviews.Content: A great hotel! Walking distance from most attractions, clean, very nice modern rooms, and all of the staff was very friendly. The pool was an added bonus...although not a pool for those that can't swim or young children...it starts at 5+ feet and goes to 9ft. This will definetly be the hotel we stay at in New Orleans from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: DLMusic
Reviews.Content: Clean and spacious rooms, friendly staff, a gym, free wi-fi, a rooftop pool, and a decent restaurant is what you'll find here. This is not five star by any means, but if you're looking for a decent place to spend the night, I would highly recommend this hotel, especially if you're a family on a budget. There are Louisiana sight-seeing books that are filled with coupons and the concierge is very knowledgeable about available tours and things to do in the city. However, be forewarned about a couple of things that have NOTHING to do with the hotel. First, they are doing a lot of construction outside the hotel, so don't be surprised if you wake up to jackhammers around 9:00 a.m. Second, the hotel concierge takes a fee for booking tours you can book on your own. Third, taxis here have a very odd pricing scheme. For example, a family of four can get from here to the French Quarter/French Market (about 4 miles away) for about $11; however, the two-minute 1.2 mile cab ride from the cruise ship dock cost $33. Wanna go to the airport from here? $15 per person, or $33 for one. As I said, taxi fares are wacky so you need to be prepared to cough up more $$ if you don't get your fare ahead of time. This hotel is a little off the beaten path, which can be a positive or negative depending on your needs. The only close store that we could find here was Walgreens. Everything else was back in the French Quarter which is about 1.5 miles away if you want to walk it (which is totally doable). I would definitely recommend this hotel to someone coming to New Orleans for the first time or if you are bookending your cruise with a night or two in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “A mediocre hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week at a reunion in June. The hotel has been renovated and the rooms are comfortable, but it is an old hotel. The airconditioner either blows very cold, but absolutely necessary in the hot and humid summer. Had to call manager to clean filters, the dust was making us cough so much. Walls are thin, and the noise from other rooms, latenighters in the halls, and early street construction, made sleep difficult. The staff at the desk, Cindy, the concierge, and the prompt response from management were all excellent. The food in the restaurant was fair, room service was poor, and some of the wait-staff in the restaurant left much to be desired. Because of the group discount, the price was reasonable for this location. We have stayed in other locations in this city, and would not return here again, even if the price was better here.

Reviews.Title: “Recently remodeled, but still an old feel”
Reviews.Author: Mrm2u2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights and was please with the remodeling, but you still relize it is an old hotel. The rooms are nice size and decorated contemporary style. Staff was helpful as I returned to my room after a day of work and found small black bugs crawling out of the sink and on the walls throughout the room. Definitely a turn off, but the staff was knocking on my door with a new room key only minutes after I called the front desk. So pleased with the staff and I saw no signs for bugs anymore. So overall the hotel is average...minus the bugs in my room #1118 and moved to 1128. The hotel has a good fitness room and outside pool, but no whirlpool...

Reviews.Title: “Short but Sweet”
Reviews.Author: ColeyL30
Reviews.Content: I had a short but sweet stay at the Holiday Inn before going on a Carnival Cruise. New Orleans had always been one of my bucket list cities and this trip was my 30th Birthday Present from my Godmother. We had called ahead and spoke with the concierge Jennifer who helped us secure our tickets for the Cajun Encounters Plantation and Swamp Tours. Unfortunately we never got to meet Jennifer but Cindy was ready and waiting for us upon our arrival with our tickets and she also booked us for the Jazz Riverboat Cruise that night. When we mentioned everything that we had done to Oswald he was quiet impressed and said that we did a great job of doing everything and experiencing the city in the short two days we were there, he also helped us secure Joe for a ride to the ship on Sunday morning. The front desk staff was also very nice and helpful especially Patrice who has promised to visit me in Chicago since I also work for a hotel and would love to extend the same hospitality right back at all of them!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay in NoLa.”
Reviews.Author: Wendy_from_Holland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. It was not easy to get to the hotel with all the road works nearby, but once we finally had arrived at the hotel eveything was supurb. Evan at check in was friendly, the room was very spacious and clean. We had a private balcony with pool and downtown view. The pool was great and clean with nice place to sit or lay down. We had dinner one night in the restaurant which was good. Location is ok, ten minute walk from french quarter. I never felt unsafe in surrounding area. Would return to HI Superdome without hesitation. Nice detail: near the elevator on our floor (11th) hung a painting of queen Beatrix of the Netherlands. We are Dutch, so that was really a nice coincidence.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: NegrilBride
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a work event and the Hyatt where our event was held was overbooked, so I found myself at the Holiday Inn. I have stayed at worse Holiday Inns; I have stayed at better Holiday Inns. We were promised renovated rooms. The room itself had been redecorated but the bathrooms were very old and showed their age and grime. The shower did not drain. Maintenance was sent up fairly quickly and fixed the problem. Overall, not a bad stay. The noise from the street woke me up numerous times during the night, but there is not much the hotel can do about that. The location isn't fantastic. I would not advise for women to walk alone at night on the surrounding streets. Stay safe and take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovated rooms, location OK”
Reviews.Author: Karastar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past Memorial Day weekend. Since I was an IHG priority member, they gave me buy one get one drink coupons in the lobby bar, and free breakfast buffets for every morning of our stay. There was also free wifi in the rooms, which was a really nice perk. The rooms have just been renovated and they are great. Beds are very comfortable. After trying the breakfast buffet the first morning, we knew we wouldn't return. Very meager selection of "packaged" eggs, bacon, tough sausage, fruit. But after looking at other guest's plates in the restaurant who had ordered off the menu, their food actually looked delicious. So I'd say if you're eating in the hotel, skip the buffet and order off the menu. To get to the French Quarter, I'd suggest taking a cab (about $7 - $10 for 4 people), especially at night. But if you want to go to Harrahs, or anywhere down Poydras Street, you can easily walk. It's not far. I never felt unsafe, but there is a lot around the hotel that's under construction. If you're looking for a hotel that is affordable, is clean and comfortable, this is your place. However, if you want something in the heart of New Orleans or more of a boutique hotel that has local charm, this is not your place. Just depends on what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Superdome Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Tuyet N
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel I have come across thus far. The bathrooms do not have a vent. The room I checked into had a foul odor that did not go away for hours. I checked in at around 1 am and the receptionist at the time was not kind at all. I do not care what the time of day is, your job is to make me want to stay. Holiday Inn lost me as a customer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly service, 10 minute walk to Bourban Street.”
Reviews.Author: migresch
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable hotel, far enough from the French Quarter to be quiet, close enough for an easy (10 min walk). Rouse's grocery is 4 blocks away if you want to stock the small fridge in your room. We were 6 friends traveling as a group, and picked up wine, cheese, pÃ¢tÃ© and bread for a very nice lunch at the side of the pool (not sure we were allowed to but no-one stopped us). The pool area was clean and quiet. Four in our group were on the 8th floor on the Loyola avenue side of the hotel: be aware that the tram line is under construction there and they were awoken early by the drills and heavy machinery. My wife and I were on the 17th floor at the back of the hotel and had no such trouble. There is indoor parking for $25 per night. We breakfasted at the hotel; the buffet ($11.95) was adequate: scrambled eggs, cereal, yogurt, one choice of meat, pancakes, french toast, fruit mix, no breads and no toaster. There was also an a-la-carte breakfast menu which had more and better choices if you have the time. Service here at breakfast ranged from exceptional (Xavier) to dim-witted. There is an IHOP on canal street (7 minutenwalk from the hotel). We ate lunch and dinners out at various restaurants. In summary: above average for a Holiday Inn and we would go back and we will recommend it to friends who may be traveling to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: roselleleone
Reviews.Content: I found the experience to be very pleasant. The rooms were clean, updated and cozy. The hotel also had a pool. It was a little small but clean and a good amount of lounging space. The service was great. Hotel staff was always friendly and willing to help. For example, we needed extra towels and they were brought to our room within 5 minutes. We also asked where the pool was and a staff member walked us there. As for location, the hotel is within walking distance of the Bourbon Street and other must sees; however, it is a little bit of a walk. I didn't mind it during the day, but at night we preferred to take a cab which was about $10 for 3 people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on a verry good location.”
Reviews.Author: Daanski
Reviews.Content: If you are young than you shout choice this hotel. Bourbon street and wallgreen/CVS are on walking distance. If you get by car, than the hotel is easly to reach from the I-10. The bed are good to sleep on.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for its kind.”
Reviews.Author: LuiscPeru
Reviews.Content: The hotel as I see it, was completely renewed. They should also renew the main entrance (it was a little bit antique). After this I enjoyed its pool, their complimentary apples and also their free coffe flavors they give you for using in a coffe machine. It is never to late to innovate. This hotel offers a little bottle of mouth refreshment liquid. A very cool detail not to be forgotten by me. By the way I requested the highest floor and they gave me the 17th. Too high to be disturbed by the noise of lower floors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service very nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Noelmb
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice 4-day stay. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. Absolutely no noises. It is very well located, specially close to the Superdome. Walking distance from the streetcar and french quarter. Staff is very nice and professional. Special comments to front-desk attendant Juanita. Very nice service. I will definetly come back here whenever in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy if you have a room at front of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: TN32
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning of May for a conference at the Convention Center. Overall, this hotel is a pleasant surprise and is probably better than most Holiday Inns. Rooms are comfortable and clean and staff is friendly. It is also only 10 minutes' walk away from Bourbon street and close to the Walgreens/CVS on Canal street if you want to pick up some snack and drinks since the room also comes with a mini-fridge. The only complaint is that there is construction going on at the moment at the front of the hotel on the Loyola Ave side, so if you don't want to be woken up at 6AM, ask for a room on the other side of the hotel. Since I was there for a conf and had to be up early in any case, it did not matter. It looks as if the construction will be going on for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for Superdome goers”
Reviews.Author: txpillman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of our cruise, since we could park our car there at no extra charge. They have very secure parking that is actually floors 3-6 of the hotel, and you have to enter through the hotel lobby. Not many other secure parking places in NOLA. We arrived 2 days before the cruise so we could get a taste of the French Quarter. Forty-seven years ago we honeymooned at the Royal Orleans hotel in the Quarter, and wanted an updated look. Before we left home I had researched all the recommended places to eat, and using YELP was able to find some really good local eateries within walking distance of the hotel. I review the restaurants later. The concierge's spouse happened to be a local chef, so she was able to help us as well. Streetcars are within walking distance, and we enjoyed taking those rather than taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value In New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Carol K
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Downtown-Superdome in New Orleans is a great hotel offering spacious rooms (with a very comfortable bed, two sinks, microwave and refrigerator!) and excellent amenities, including a good restaurant and bar, pool, exercise room, and concierge services. It is centrally located close to the French Quarter (10 minute walk), Canal Street and the Trolleys that take you uptown to the Museums, Garden District, Galleries, City Park, and all the sites of New Orleans. You are close enough to all the action, but are able to retreat to a quiet, comfortable lodging. The service is excellent. All of the staff are friendly and great at their jobs. We especially appreciated Emmett, the Bell Captain, who was so much more - offering assistance in where to go and how to get there. This is a 4-star hotel with a two-star price in a city that can be pricey. We were there for the Jazz Festival and overheard what people were paying for rooms in other hotels - ours was half the cost!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rob W
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great experience in the hotel. Thank you to Ms. Juanita for pointing us to the hotel and ensuring that we had a great stay. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Mother's Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda W
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Holiday Inn Superdome over the Mother's Day weekend 2012! We were there for our neice's college graduation! This was my first time in New Orleans. Thank you Ms. Juanita and other staff members there who provided superb customer service at the front desk and at breakfast! This Holiday Inn is one of the nicest I have stayed at! The rooms were very large and roomy, clean, and the beds comfortable. It's close to everything we wanted to visit. I will recommend this hotel to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Jazzfest Stay”
Reviews.Author: lonniesun
Reviews.Content: The hotel has just been renovated, and on the most part is really comfortable. The rooms are fantastic, but still have old air conditioners. I booked through priceline, and my room was not ready when I went to go check in. I was told to come back after 4pm. My bell hop was excellent! Emmett was very accommodating, and took care of my luggage for me until I was able to check in. Construction on Loyola for the new streetcar line will be fantastic when it is all done.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was good..Just very expensive buffet breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Surfsidesandcrab
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, room was nice and clean, employees were very helpful and happy and they would likely have gotten a 5 star from me but....there wasn't a safe installed in my room when we got there. Had to inform them and get one installed. The bathroom door does not close shut due to the steel frame is out of sorts. The hotel is a few blocks off Canal St. and can look a little scarey in the dark. But my biggeswt complaint was the buffet breakfast. Starts at $11.95 per person and an ok selection. ( wish I had ordered off the menu) Then when we ordered coffee and milk to go with the lame buffet we were not told that beverages were not included.(most buffets do include some beverages) So that ended up to an extra 2.50 per person on the bill. So that ends up, including a tip, to be over $30.00 just to have an OK breakfast. Beware of eating in the restaurant....

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great service”
Reviews.Author: Julie N
Reviews.Content: I was recently in NoLA for a tradeshow at the convention center, but came early for to check out the city. I was traveling with my mother and my baby daughter. The hotel was a pleasant surprise, particularly the guest rooms, which were clean and modern, with mini-fridge and microwave. And the pool area is FANTASTIC--almost like a SoHo rooftop, with modern lounging areas and cabanas. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the edge of the French Quarter, about 20 minutes to the Cafe du Monde. For us, this was no problem, and the hotel has the benefit of being out of the hustle & bustle of the party district--it feels calm & quiet. More than anything, the staff went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. Everyone we passed offered a warm greeting, and Mr. Emmet, the bellman, was so lovely with our baby, and helped us get loaded into a cab for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hannah1010
Reviews.Content: This hotel room has been renovated fairly recently and its really comfortable. The room has a seperate sink outside of the bathroom which I prefer. The location is good too as its about a 10 minute walk to Bourbon and Canal Streets and its nice to stay a little bit out of the chaos. The hotel has a nice pool above the carpark and a gym that faces the pool. The staff were all really helpful and I really liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras stay”
Reviews.Author: Justy R
Reviews.Content: Great customer service, but we were there during Mardi Gras and only 3 out of the 4 elevators were working for an entire week. Also, the restaurant inside the hotel was something you would want to skip. Bad food/service. Overall, close to the festivities and clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: mauiwaves
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are outstanding and very helpful. The hotel and room were clean and well kept. The room appeared recently renovated. It is within walking distance to both Burbon Street and the Superdome. It can be difficult to catch a cab, so walk a block or two to a more major street. The breakfast was good and reasonably priced for New Orleans. this hotel has a 4 PM checkin time, but they do have a bell hop to store your bags. Would stay here again if we ever end up in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to Superdome”
Reviews.Author: kmjr2008
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans on business and the Holiday Inn was 5 minutes from the office. Rooms were remodeled from my last visit a year ago. Very nice, all that you could want in a room. Friendly staff and restaurant dinner was good. Only CON was I needed to get a taxi to the French Quarter, I will return again on business , but if you are on vacation , get something closer to the French Quarter

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location.”
Reviews.Author: hungrypr
Reviews.Content: The staff really made the trip for me, now have stayed here three of the last four years while coming for Jazz Fest. A short walk up to Canal Street and the streetcar, which can bring you around town. About .15 minutes to Bourbon St and their neighboring party streets.

Reviews.Title: “Functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Palman13
Reviews.Content: I had to go to New Orleans fro some business and the options were nicer in other locations near the Quarter but I needed to be in the business area near the Super Dome so opted for Holiday Inn in the downtown.Super Dome area. It offer basis function at a fair price. The room size was actually very good sized, with balconies, but the amenities were basis, not luxury. Bed was comfortable and there was a microwave and small fridge in the room. Good basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: tracy s
Reviews.Content: This was truely one of the nicest properties I have ever stayed. The room was gorgeous and very accomodating. The staff was warm, friendly, and helpful. The restaurant/bar and service was fantastic. My girls loved the roof top pool. The parking deck was easy to use with a fast elevator to zip you to your room from any level. Three blocks from the trolly and close to all "must sees" for New Orleans. This was our first time to the city and we will most certainly be returning!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, although some of the staff are a bit too laid back!”
Reviews.Author: RichardJStokes
Reviews.Content: We visited New Orleans for the Final Four when the hotel was full - had a lovely room and a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are very nice!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinGal920
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during Mardi Gras. The rooms are nicely furnished and clean. The exterior of the building needs work, but don't let that defer you. It is about 5 blocks from the French Quarter and seemed safe to walk at night. Of course the Superdome is next door. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: gambler1NJ
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the Final Four Basketball with the Holiday Inn Downtown located between the SuperDome and the French Quarter. Very convenient with a short walk between each. Nice outdoor pool on the 8th floor and adequate fitness center. Free use of the business center for emails let me leave the laptop home. Nice bar and restaurant. First time I tried alligator and it wasnt too bad!

Reviews.Title: “Near Superdome but not much else”
Reviews.Author: nancydNC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Final Four in New Orleans.We spent 6 nights at this Holiday Inn.Positives: 1. walkiing distance to Superdome.2. clean property, well taken care of,3. Nice employees 4. rapid response to a broken toilet 5. Restaurant-not bad for a Holiday Inn 6. comfortable beds. Negatives: 1. It is a long walk to anyplace. 4 blocks to the Canal St trolley through an area which was not so great. Wouldn't walk there at night.2. The shuttle that was advertised was never seen by me-maybe it worked for some, but I never saw it at the hotel.3.Air conditioning-the old fashioned kind in a unit against the wall so it blows all of the time. Very loud and cold. If you turned the cold down at all, it was hot--just not much control over it.4. We did have a theft of a Final Four momento from our room which was disappointing. They do have a safe for important things thank goodness.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise and park”
Reviews.Author: robare02
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to park and stay when cruising out of New Orleans. The sliding door in the room needed repair but the parking was good and safe. Had shuttle to the ship also to french qt. but had to get back on out own. $10 for cab. The bar was a nice area, friendly. We also took a cab back to the hotel from the ship and that work out well. Great grocery store 3 block away if you get pointed in the right direction. I was not but found it. Will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: paulperrone
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel. Front desk staff, especially Patrice, very helpful. We had our 12 year old grandson ariving the next day and she blocked a room next to ours. I ran short or CD's to burn some pictures and the executive office gave me one without charge. The staff in the restaurant could take some lessons from the front desk. Service in the restaurant was not as good as the rest of the service. Overall a good location and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews can be misleading...would stay somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: Mary F
Reviews.Content: We stay at hotels frequently due to travel with cheer. This weekend was no different. We had to wait several minutes for the elevator, which was very uncomfortable when waiting in the parking garage. At times, when the elevator finally made it, it was at capacity and we had to wait minutes for the next one. In our room, the door was messed up and it took hours for maintanence to get there. Our iron did not work and I called for it early that Saturday morning, yet we still did not get an iron until after 3 pm that evening. When I talked to the housekeeper, she told me "We came to your door and you didn't answer", I told her "I told the attendent that we had to leave by 7, so we were no longer in our room. She said "Oh, well I didn't get in until after that anyway"... :-( Showers: The hot water went out on Saturday and did not come back on until after 7 am on Sunday. Unfortunately, we had to leave by 7:10, so we took cold showers and had to go outside in the cold weather. The hotel promised a shuttle, which was the primary reason for staying there. It was to my understanding that the shuttle driver called in that Sunday, so everyone was on their own. HUH??? Listen....the rooms are just okay and the service left alot to be desired. The HR manager attempted to make amends, but the stay was not an enjoyable one. If you have a choice, stay elsewhere. Sorry, but it's my truth and I value the feedback on these pages when choosing hotels. P.S. Please be advised that you can hear every siren that comes in the area....

Reviews.Title: “bag left behind delivered immediately”
Reviews.Author: Carolynn38052
Reviews.Content: Once again we stayed at the hotel for the park and cruise deal. We have always had excellant service and a great night in New Orleans! After cruise we picked up car and went 300 miles home. We discovered we had left a bag outside the hotel door and someone found it and brought it to the desk. This bag contained my husband's heart & BP meds which we needed now!!!! I called the hotel and talked to Melvin in Security Dept - he found the bag and got my information and the bag was shipped overnight free of charge to me. I was very appreciative of this superior service. Thank you Holiday Inn Superdome!

Reviews.Title: “Exciting Trip”
Reviews.Author: Laketha R
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful and the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. There was one employee at the desk that went the extra mile for us and her name was Juanita. The other staff was friendly but she stepped beyond the call. We are planning on coming back and this is the hotel that we will be making our reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Best Flexible Rate may not be flexible”
Reviews.Author: whitecalla
Reviews.Content: Don't make the same mistake I did...."best flexible rate" may not be best and it may not be flexible if there is a "Special event" going on. I chose the "best flexible rate" because I thought my plans may change (which they did) and I was charged for the entire stay when I had to cancel my reservation (because there was a "special event" my deposit was 100% and nonrefundable)...be careful!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but DO NOT take return SHUTTLE!”
Reviews.Author: joyy30
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice. The room was very spacious, clean and comfortable! The only bad part of our hotel stay and cruise was the return shuttle! Waited outside terminal for over an hour before Cajun excursions came to pick anyone up! Take a taxi from the port!!! It's only a dollar more! Holiday Inn really should have their own shuttle service for cruise terminal!

Reviews.Title: “A great value!”
Reviews.Author: Aimee H
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel while attending a conference in New Orleans, and I was very pleased. The hotel was clean and affordable and the staff was friendly and helpful. The free shuttle was extremely convenient. Emmett (the driver) was always there right on time to accommodate my transportation needs! Also, the restaurant was surprisingly affordable with many delicious dishes! All in all, my stay was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Trvlr01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a last-minute stop in New Orleans for the final day of Mardi Gras. I initially had little hope of getting a room anywhere, let alone at a decent price, yet this place came up and was really inexpensive especially considering the date/event going on. Clearly it has been recently renovated. Very nice, spacious room. Very clean. Just a couple blocks from the French Quarter...a real plus without all the noise and craziness. Very friendly front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: mmtripsOhio
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, well maintained and looked recently updated. Carpet, beds and most amenities in the room looked new. Staff was helpful and very accommodating. Hotel is within walking distance to Bourbon Street, the French Quarter and Riverfront. Parking was $25 per day in a covered garage directly below the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, But Nothing Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Niceville-Bill
Reviews.Content: Nice facility. However, noise from road construction, and Police/EMS sirens were most annoying. We were told Shuttle Service was suspended because of the congestion of Mardi Gras. This forced a walking safari to get to public transportation, as Taxies were nonexistent on the streets of this part of town. Entry into the lobby was via a set of three steps. No ramps, so the roll around luggage had to be carried or go bumpity bump up the steps. There are four elevators; but they are slow. Our trip from the 11th floor to the front desk took 15 minutes. Frequency of â€œgoing downâ€� elevators was every five or six minutes. Each and every one was full! Finally we rode the elevator up three floors and started down stopping at each and every floor, confronting small crowds wanting to ride down. Room was nice; however, sliding door to outdoor balcony would not latch nor close completely. Sink and Tub drained slowly. Electric outlet at sink went dead. Coffee pot backup; mad a mess. Mess was only partially cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans - Good choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clembo1957
Reviews.Content: A refurbished Holiday Inn in the Central Business District, my stay was on the first night of Mardi Gra so both the hotel and New Orleans were pretty busy on a Saturday night. My room was on the 16th floor with a good view of downtown (the lower floors are the garage level so there's plenty of parking). My room was very clean had two Queen Anne Double beds, TV and a decent bathroom. Breakfast is served in the downstairs restaurant and is good quality. The hotel is around 12 blocks from the Amtrak Station, handy for the Super Dome and a short walk from Canal St and an easy walk to Bourbon St and the French Quarter. Despite negative publicity i felt perfectly safe walking around the area and walked back from the French Quarter at 2am with no problems. There is a free shuttle to the French Quarter and other points which runs hourly until 10pm which the hotel staff encourage guests to use. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. Overall a great experience and i wouldn't hesitate the use the hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Connie & Larry, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Larry S
Reviews.Content: A Great location, and hotel property was exceptional. The Hotel rooms were very clean and comfortable with new furnishings. Everything with the rooms was top notch. Juanita was very obliging and courteous, helping out with any questions we had as to getting around and what to see, as was the rest of the staff. We travelled to the hotel by car and the parkade facility worked out very well, even with the construction going on the street in front. Shuttle bus worked well for us to get us to and from the French Quarter. It was even a short walk back from the French Quarter the one evening, we decided on doing so. We were pleased with the recommendation from the tourist information center on "I 10" coming in from Biloxi, MS.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Linda K
Reviews.Content: The newly renovated rooms on the seventeenth floor were very nicely appointed. Found them to be very clean. The restaurant staff was very helpful and very friendly. Zonie and Javier were very accomodating even when we arrived late for luncheon service. The Front Desk personnel was also very welcoming and proved to be very helpful. The street in front of the hotel is under construction but staff were very good at making suggestions as to how get around the mess. We felt valued as customers and so the experience was a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: 1dennis3
Reviews.Content: Had a group of 26 people stay for one night before a cruise. management was very nice to work with in making the arrangements. Rooms were very clean and nice. Restaurant was a little pricey but convenient. Within walking distance of the French Quarter, they have free shuttle service but it only runs every hour. Over all had a nice stay and would recommend it for a pre-cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Carefree2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of the French Quarter, restaurants and attractions including Street Car lines and the Super Done. We only ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant and found it to be very good with a reasonably priced menu. The hotel and restaurant staff were very cordial and service focused. There is a shuttle service to the area of the Casino, which is a short walk to the French Market, Jackson Square and St Louis Cathedral in the lower part of the French Quarter. In the last year, the rooms and hallways have been upgraded, including flat screen TVs. There is ample parking but we did not use it as we arrived via a bus excursion to Mardi Gras. The only possible drawback to the hotel for some was the poor sound proofing of the window glass, which could affect light sleepers. The crowds leaving Mardi Gras and the sirens of emergency vehicles occurred regularly during the night. Thus, the sleep quality was rated very good, if you visit during Mardi Gras.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Irving S
Reviews.Content: The staff were so friendly and helpful. The shuttle service is very handy, and run by the very friendly and accommodating Emmett. It is a good value for a spacious and stylishly decorated room.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms, more like a 5 star hotel not a Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: alanadi25
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here and lived it! The room felt modern and luxurious. The bed and linens were very comfortable and we liked the flat screen tv and the great selection of channels. The only turn off about this hotel is the cost of parking! We couldn't believe it cost us $75 to park our car there for 3 nights. It really was a shock.

Reviews.Title: “Recent Renovations”
Reviews.Author: charlie854
Reviews.Content: I was here on a tour and for a "tour hotel" it was above average.

Reviews.Title: “Park & Sail at Superdome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpeedTrap
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because they had the park and sail feature and we needed to leave our car somewhere while we cruised the Caribbean. The hotel has had a refurbishing recently, in fact they were just finishing up wallpapering the hallway on our floor when we arrived. Our room was lovely. It was spacious and spotless. We had a sliding glass door out to the pool which was a nice feature. The only negative I can think of was the buffet breakfast which in my opinion was not worth it. Better to order off the menu if you are thinking of dining there for breakfast. The hotel shuttle will take you to several different venues such as the WWII Museum or the French Quarter to name a couple. The staff was super friendly and helpful. We are planning a trip back to New Orleans upon the completion of the trolley line that will run in front of the hotel in 2013 and will definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: batex
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good if you are in business trip or wanna stay for 2 nights in New Orleans. It has nice rooms, good location, nice service from the staff, and the cleanliness is average.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: yankeedancersgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, pre-cruise, All of the staff we encountered were absolutely wonderful. We had a newly renovated room...very nicely done. A fantastic feature was the quantity of outlets. There were 4 of us and we had no problem charging all of our electronics. There was a free hourly shuttle to the French Quarter and a couple of other stops. We ate in the restaurant a few times...food was great and the service was exceptional. Visually, all of the murals were a very nice touch, as were all the lobby decorations. I especially loved the saxaphone lamp and the clarinet mural on the outside wall. Our friends left their car there while we were on the cruise...very safe and secure parking garage. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lru
Reviews.Content: I visit New Orleans several times a year. I tried another hotel and realized I screwed up! This hotel has all the comforts of home. Clean, great service, and well maintained. I have realized that you get what you pay for in this town, and my comfort is priceless.

Reviews.Title: “cruise ship parking amenity”
Reviews.Author: fawn1820
Reviews.Content: We recently left from New Orleans on a cruise ship and used the parking amenity at the holiday inn. THis was an excellent decision. The hotel takes you to the terminal. You can park there for the week and stay the night before you leave or the night you get back. Only down side was they do not pick up on your return but taxi was very easy to get. Rooms were very nice and roomy and clean, in fact seemed newly remodeled. Beware of the shuttle service...they only pick up at certain points so get that infor before you leave. We had to walk back down some dark streets because we did not know this and they would not come and get us unless we walked back about 5 blocks. So we walked back, weren't very happy about this. The rooftop pool looked very nice, did not get to use it. Concierge people were very helpful in setting up a tour for us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff and Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: laramib
Reviews.Content: have recently returned from a week long stay at the Holiday Inn Downtown-Superdome in New Orleans. I want to personally compliment the entire staff of that hotel and in particular desk clerks Pattrice and Lucien who gave service far beyond what was expected. I am a professional photographer and was attending a photo conference in New Orleans last week while staying at your hotel. After a long day of seminars, I returned to the hotel in a cab and l left a $10,000 camera in the back seat. When I realized that I had done such a stupid thing it was too late. The cab had gone and I didn't have any information about its identification or that of the driver. I thought my camera was lost for sure. That is where desk clerks Lucian and Pattrice came to my rescue. Lucian told me he thought that the cab was a Yellow Cab and Pattrice started making phone calls. They were initially told that the cab could not be identified with so little information but they both kept calling and would not give up. After close to an hour the cab returned and the driver had my camera with him. If it had not been for the efforts of your staff I don't believe the camera would have ever been returned. Not only that, but I have to say the property was extremely clean and well maintained. I travel often and this is one of the best stays I have ever experienced. Thanks to Holiday Inn and especially to Lucian and Pattrice.

Reviews.Title: “This Holiday Inn Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Pree K
Reviews.Content: My experience here was incredible! I stayed at this location while on an interview and I must say, it's one of the best Holiday Inn's I've been to. The rooms were neat, clean, elegant looking but the best part of the experience was actually the service! The front desk staff was more than helpful, particularly Juanita T. who went out of her way to help me with each of the "hiccups" that I came across while I was on my trip. Honestly, this is the first review I've ever written on a hotel, but the service was so incredible, there's no way I couldn't have said thanks! I'm sold, whenever I'm in New Orleans, I'll only be staying at this location! Thank you again for making my stay more stress-free!

Reviews.Title: “BEST Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: AL I
Reviews.Content: As a Retired Holiday Inn General Manager, (Southern California), and now having traveled the entire USA, staying at many Holiday Inns, I am somewhat uniquely "qualified" to "rate" this property and staff. It is excellent in every regard! While many Holiday Inns simply have "hotel food" to retain the Brand Name, this property has great food, including a wonderful breakfast buffet! While many Holiday Inns are excellent, many more are very good, there is only ONE "BEST", and in my opinion, which I think is a very good one, this property is BEST! Additionally, I find it to be the best Value in New Orleans. This writing is based up more than 1 stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: smilnes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in conjunction with a "cruise and park" deal (stay one night, park a total of 8 nights including 7 while on your cruise - a very good deal!). Very impressed with the room - by far the best room we've seen at a Holiday Inn and, for that matter, almost all other hotel brands. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful as were the shuttle bus drivers (particularly Emmitt who was fantastic). Being a Priority Club member they threw us a voucher for a free breakfast buffet, which made eating there affordable. If you are going to NOLA primarily for the French Quarter scene, it's not really very far to walk (five or six blocks to Bourbon and Canal) but it can be a little taxing if you are going to continue on down to Jackson Square, Cafe DuMonde, the French Market, etc. Consider the free hotel shuttle at the point (drops you off at Peters and Conti not far from Jackson Square). Also, while we walked back to the hotel room twice - once during the day and once in the early evening - I'd probably do the shuttle (or taxi) next time in the evening as there weren't a lot of other folks out and about the last few blocks near the hotel (a little too quiet for me - safety in numbers you know). While I prefer to be just a little bit closer to the FQ, I'd definitely stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: fournix
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Saints/Lions playoff game and the BCS Championship Game. Super busy weekend and a super packed hotel. But everything went smoothly. Quick check-in (they let us check in two hours early!), plenty of parking in the garage ($23/day), and a mostly friendly staff. The room itself was awesome. Decent sized so we never felt cramped for space. We had a poolside room and it was so nice to be able to walk right outside the door and just relax. It was surprisingly quiet out there most of the weekend. The bed was very comfortable and I loved the new modern look of the room. The only time I visited the restaurant was for the breakfast buffet. My husband was given vouchers for a free breakfast buffet for each day of the stay. But they only gave them to him, not me. So I had to pay $15 to eat at the buffet. NOT worth it. I thought the food was terrible. But ordering off the menu may be better -- I just didn't try it. Really, the best part of this hotel to me is its location. You can walk to the Superdome, the French Quarter, Rouse's, Riverwalk, Harrah's, etc... Plenty of things to keep you entertained within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled”
Reviews.Author: BatonRougeLSS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for the National Championship football game - so a busy weekend. The hotel is actually much nicer than I was expecting. Everything is remodeled. So brand new carpet, bathrooms, beds, etc. The staff was friendly, even during a super busy weekend. The best part - is is WALKING distance from the Superdome.

Reviews.Title: “Vacationing with Hubby”
Reviews.Author: tywina
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great and I do mean Great. The hotel was recently renovated and our room was beautiful from door to balcony. Everything was new. The Bed was so confortable, I haven't slept this well in a long time. The staff was just so hospitable. Juanita and Brandy were wonderful and Emmett was a great help. This was our first trip to New Orleans and I will not be our last. New Orleans is a very nice spot to vacation but staying here also influenced our future return.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, new renovations, but some old items need fixing”
Reviews.Author: puddlejump
Reviews.Content: First of all, the staff here are very attentive and hospitable. The hotel itself is older, but has newly renovated rooms. Our room was renovated with two full-size beds, very nice. However the sliding glass door to the balcony (facing the Superdome side) was the original door, and was terribly beat-up to the point where it would no longer close and lock; the locking mechanism was smashed, and the door rollers had come off their tracks. This would not be cause for concern for adults or crime, rather for the safety of young children; additionally the slight gap in the door allowed slight wind and sound inside, luckily we were on a high floor, so sound was muffled. The layout of the hotel has 5-6 levels of parking garage at the base of the building. There are only four elevators, so we had heavy traffic during the day of the Bowl Game between the Ragin' Cajuns and SDSU; lack of elevators is the main drawback of this hotel; everyone has to use the same elevators, staff and guests. The Ragin' Cajun fans were awesome, all over our hotel and the surrounding areas, having fun before and after the NO Bowl. We were on a very loud floor with unsupervised children running and screaming at night, so the next morning we got breakfast for our family, which was nice; the hotel was full so we could not switch rooms. The public restroom downstairs by the breakfast buffet was kind of gross; rooms were clean and most renovated floors, but some public areas were worn out. The business center computers barely worked. Our child got lost on one of the elevators while loading the bags onto a luggage cart, and if you go to this hotel you will realize that there are tons of places where those elevators could go with the parking decks especially. Lucky for us, a kind construction worker saw him on the 15th floor (which was being renovated), and brought him down to the lobby for us; to that man, THANKS again, Brother! We took the free hotel shuttle to the Cruise Ship port of NO, and went to the Caribbean for a week. Walking distance to the French Quarter, we ate at Bourbon House (Deanie's and Acme were packed), the baked oyster trio was excellent, per usual, though the fried seafood platter was just okay. Cafe du Monde for fresh beignets, superb! Overall, a nice stay, once the renovations are all complete, and sliding doors replaced this place will be even better. Location is decent, slightly remote and quiet at night, but not unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “First day”
Reviews.Author: Tjvanb
Reviews.Content: We have been here one night and would not stay again unless our experience greatly improves. For 225 a night you do not get even a continental breakfast even though told on phone we do. They advertise "free coffee" from 8 to 10 but when we went down for a cup we were told" I guess i have to give you a cup as its still written that way" as he hands my husband a styrofoam cup with attitude. We have 17 family members staying here for the bowl game and I feel horrible that I helped choose this place, the pool is so hot you can't swim in it! The hospital is down the road so sirens all night. I will take my red roof inn anyday for a fourth the price and double the emenities and nice people,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Chrisjenskie
Reviews.Content: I would like to extend a huge THANK YOU to you and your staff. We were a very lively bunch (11-13 yr boys/football players & girls/cheerleaders) and your staff was extremely nice/patient. Mrs. Shelly D. you were such a great support in the process of getting our 27 rooms established and organized, 98% on one floor. Mrs. Patrice was wonderful with the front desk proceedures. We will definately recommend future stays with you all. Our youth football team finished the tournament successfully in 2nd place and plan to return next year to claim 1st. Thank you all again! Merry Christmas & Happy New Year!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed very much”
Reviews.Author: chuckles0901
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent, I am always looking for the best value and deal for my clients. We have booked may of our cruise clients at this hotel because of their park and cruise program. They (Trudy) are always able to offer me the best rates when available. Last week we departed on our first cruise out of New Orleans and of course I called Trudy and was offered a great rate. We were able to leave our car there in their covered garage for the duration of our cruise and received a shuttle transfer to the pier, all for free I might add. The staff was very nice and helpful and the room was clean, newly remodeled and beautiful. There is no doubt that we will stay here again. Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Superdome Hotel was great!!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy C
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel and we were very happy from the time we walked in the door and the desk clerks had wonderful smiles and happy comments till we left 8 days later. All the help was very gracious and very pleasant. Our rooms were top rate with being very clean and plenty of space with all new furnishings. We enjoyed every thing about our stay and would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, very helpful”
Reviews.Author: S_MJW
Reviews.Content: Room was very comfortable & clean, but the best part was the staff. My husband hurt his ankle & we thought our trip was ruined, but the people at the desk found a cane in a back office that saved the day. The shuttle was out of commission, but we were reimbursed for taxi service during the normal shuttle hours (be aware - it operates only until 10:00pm & doesn't go into the French Quarter, but will drop off on the perimeter close enough to walk in). If it hadn't been for the bad ankle, we could easily have walked to and from the French Quarter from the hotel. We were in New Orleans to go to a football game at the Superdome & it was an easy walk to & from the game, again thanks to the borrowed cane. The hotel is located just 2 blocks from the E2 bus that goes to & from the airport. Takes a little longer than a taxi or shuttle, but saves money for other fun. The only problem was the pool was not heated as I was told, but they were working on it. I would definitely stay here again. Thanks to the entire staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you are cruising,but be aware..”
Reviews.Author: NautiBoy
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1 night stay/8 ngts parking through stay123.com...got a better deal than paying for cruise terminal(7 nghts)parking alone, which gave us an extra night to enjoy the city before getting on the ship. The remodel was going on(stayed on Nov19th)but was not a problem as we had a newly redone room w/balcony, with all the amenities needed for a sleep/wakeup. We did not take breakfast at the hotel as we read it was not done well for a couple reasons and chose to walk to a nearby IHOP on Canal St.(just 2 block walk). We had a shuttle take us down to the riverfront in the quarter, which was nice...and we stayed out late enough that we walked back to the hotel, rather than trying to catch a ride back(a bit scary, but doable)..The next morning check out was quick, and the shuttle took us to the cruise terminal. The driver gave us a bus. card for the hotel, so that we could call for a pick up upon returning from cruising..When we were back at the cruise terminal a week later, I called the number on the card, and Patrice, from the front desk told me that the shuttle ONLY dropped customers OFF at the cruise ter. and expressly would NOT pick them up there...so we grabbed a taxi back to the hotel(luckily I had cash put aside in case of this..) Overall, it was a good experience, and we would do it again for the price, even with the shuttle situation...just be advised to expect this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Arvis L
Reviews.Content: My organization, Knights of Peter Claver, Memphis, TN, has booked rooms at this facility for several years and we have enjoyed our stay each time. Our contact person at the hotel, Trudy Guidroz, has been an excellent representative for the hotel. As the trip coordinator for our organization, I am empowered to contract with a hotel of my choice and I will keep on choosing this one as long as I feel we are appreciated, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and we receive good service.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: seauonboard
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal (park & cruise). If I had to pay full price I think I would have been disappointed. The location was ok. The hotel was being remodeled but it was obvious that our room hadn't been touched yet. Not only was the furniture worn but the carpets were dirty. Taking that into consideration that the hotel is being remodeled it's possible we would stay there again if the price was right. Shuttle was slow picking up from pick up points.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, room and staff.”
Reviews.Author: Deb C
Reviews.Content: We brought a group with us for pre-cruise stay. Only compliments from everyone for the Holiday Inn Superdome. We were all on 15th, 16th and 17th floors with lovely newly renovated rooms. Trudy Guidroz, in group sales, was extremely accomodating and prompt in arranging our stay. The Hotel Restaurant had very good food at a reasonable price. Shuttle service was prompt and had friendly drivers (to Harrah's, French Quarter and Cruise Pier). Overall, we enjoyed our stay. I'd recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, poor neighborhood, be carefull of breakfast deal”
Reviews.Author: josza
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is theoretically very good. Reasonable walking distance to French Quarter and famous Burbon street, walking distance to trams. But neighborhood itself was scary. Many abandonned buildings (quite depressing to see), rats on the street (sic, we really saw them near the hotel), feeling unsafe while walking toward French Quarter. We got very nice, renovated room located on 17th floor. And the price was really attractive for such high room standard. However the view from the hotel was not exactly what I would expect staying so high and it was surprisingly noisy during nights. We decided to take a rate with breakfast included. I would not recommend this to other people. The rate was 20USD higher and was supposed to provide breakfast for 2. Instead we got 20USD cupon for breakfast in hotel restaurant, but first day we were told that when we order breakfast this gives us only 20USD off our bill. The rest we have to pay ourselves. We ended up paying additional 25USD for the first breakfast (18% tip was included in price). Than we decided not to eat breakfast in the hotel the second day and use both remaining cupons the last day.
