Surprisingly at first we learnt that we cannot use both cupons one day (even though we paid for them!), but we can order breakfast and we don't have to pay extra even if we overpass 20USD. Then hotel staff decided to cancel 25USD from our account for the first breakfast. I really don't like such unclear situtations, so this is the reason why I would rather resign from breakfast in the hotel and went to some nice cafe which can be found nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable buyt well-used hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrandyCoveRetiree
Reviews.Content: The hotel was undergoing renovations and the same elevators were being used by staff, contractors and guests, so waiting for the elevator was a bit of a pain. The pool was also out of action during renovation. The rooms were dated, but reasonably clean and the beds very comfortable. Breakfast was good and the wifi worked well. The location of the hotel is a little way off the main part of the town and the French Quarter, and we had to choose our route back to the hotel carefully at night as the immediate vicinity is rather dark and run down. Overall it was a good experience and it would be very convenient if you wanted to go to the Superbowl.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is average, shuttle unreliable”
Reviews.Author: Monica T
Reviews.Content: The hotel was average, a little dated/worn out but they were going through renovations while we stayed. It was fine for the one night we stayed. The pool area was very nice with a great view. Kids had a blast swimming on the rooftop. The shuttle was unreliable though and I was not satisfied with the customer service I received when I complained. We called for a shuttle to pick us up at the pier after a day of walking around. We were told the shuttle would pick us up shortly. We waited for quite a while but I knew that it had a few stops to make before ours. Finally, we saw the shuttle across the street and thought it was coming to get us next but it turned and was going in the opposite direction. I called the hotel twice and got two different stories as to why we weren't picked up. When I got back to the hotel and spoke to the supervisor, I was told that there was no more room on the shuttle and that's why we didn't get picked up. It would have made sense for the driver to swing by (we were right across the street) and let us know that and we could have figured something else out. If we didn't notice the shuttle turning across the street, we would have been waiting for even longer.

Reviews.Title: “lsparks”
Reviews.Author: lafreda s
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed there to go on a cruise September 10th. There were about 30 of us in all. Although the hotel is under renovations we had a very pleasant stay. The customer service of the hotel employees was outstanding. I would especially like to thank one of the front desk clerks name Juanita, her personality and customer service made us feel right at home for our first New Orleans. We would definitely stay ther again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, aging facility”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeTraveler057
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 days at this hotel. I was there for training, so spent a great deal of time in the hotel. The good things first. People working at this hotel were extremely nice and helpful, including everyone from the front desk to the restaurant staff to the maids. They really made you feel welcome. As far as the room, the basics were met: comfortable bed and a hot shower with good water pressure. These are the extent of the good things. The building itself has several floors closed for renovation, ACTIVE renovation. The workers, and there were many, shared all the elevators, which would have been OK except it contributed to what seemed like terminally slow elevator service to begin with. Without exaggeration, I'm sure I waited five minutes on several occasions; it became really annoying if you wanted to go to a room during a break in training. The room furnishings were old and tired, thread bare chairs and a chest with drawers that tended to want to fall out. The closet was large, but the strange thing was one of the sliding doors was so wide that you had maybe an eighteen inch opening on either end of an eight foot closet, making it awkward to use. The blackout curtains did not extend across the entire window meaning a lot of light shined in at night. I know a hotel can't help its location, but just beware that it's a bit spooky outside as the immediate area is pretty rundown, lots of vacant buildings and sidewalks all broken up. There is a shuttle to the Quarter, but the one time I was able to go it took 25 minutes to get there. Bottom line is I would not stay here again given all the choices you have in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, accommodating staff. A fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Vidiot42
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Downtown Superdome to attend a conference in the French Quarter. The Quarter was a very easy (10-15 minute) walk away, and while the roads between the hotel and the Quarter were often deserted, I never felt unsafe. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and easily accommodated any requests I had. When I sent out laundry, it was quickly turned around and very nicely and thoroughly packaged. The hotel itself was standard Holiday Inn -- not the Waldorf, but more than adequate for my needs, quiet, and clean. The housekeeping staff could have used a bit more attention, though my room was always clean -- one housekeeper left a spray bottle of cleanser in my bathroom, and the towels provided dwindled from day to day of the stay (my first day I had towels for three, and by my last day I had to use a hand towel as a washcloth) but there were no problems or lapses in cleanliness. The hotel provides a free shuttle bus every hour, but it didn't help me out as I was heading to the west/northwest side of the Quarter (the Hotel Monteleone) and it would take people down to the foot of Canal Street by the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Sandys49
Reviews.Content: The hotel is being remodeled but our stay was just fine. I know when the remodeling is completed it will look a lot different. Loved the area, close to the Superdome and they have a shuttle to the French Quarters. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money! GREAT Roof top POOL *Stunning*”
Reviews.Author: jaemessina
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Holiday Inn for 6nights in New Orleans its a good location if you want peace and quiet from the main strip on bourbon street which is full of bars and clubs which are open every night. there is also a shuttle bus out side the hotel which is free of charge. Only ate a few times within the hotel the food was ok. The best part of the hotel would have to be the pool which is stunning its situated on the 8th floor if I can remember correctly on the roof top great view and hardly used :-/ The gym was small but has what u need ie running machine etc. if your not a fan of walking then this hotel might not be suited for you as Bourbon street is a 10-15minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Will NOT stay here again at least not until renovation is complete!”
Reviews.Author: Wayne M
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 8/8 after getting what we thought was a good deal @ 79 a night for 3 nights. The first room we got on the 11th floor was terrible. Coming off of the elevator, the floor smelled damp and musty and the room was the same way in addition to the old and dated room furniture and decor. We called the front desk and asked for another room and went back down and was switched to another room on the 8th floor. This room had obviously been updated in terms of furniture and decor, but this time, this room was windowless! In addition, part of the pool area was roped off with caution tape. We decided to check out early on Weds instead of Thursday and made reservations at the W New Orleans instead at which time the nightly rate had inexplicably changed from 79 a night to 400. It took them about 30 minutes to go in and correct it and get us on our way..by far my worst experience in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Our family loved the city.”
Reviews.Author: Gege1974
Reviews.Content: We called the hotel around 8:30 am on July 19th 2011 & asked if we could park in the lot since we were scheduled to check in later that day. The gentleman who answered the phone said that would be fine & told us to stop by the desk to inform them of our arrival. We pulled into New Orleans around 9am & stopped at the desk to let them know. We were informed that they had our room ready & that we could check in. The hotel informed us about the shuttle the hotel offers for free. The desk said to call no later then 15 till the hour to be picked up as the shuttle leaves every hour. After we got to the room which was nice & big ( we were on the 16th floor) the view was amazing. We decided to walk to the French Quarters as it was nice out. We called for the shuttle just like they said to. The shuttle took almost another hour to get there & we called & asked about it & they said it was there & gone already so it would be another hour before it would be back around. The next hour they came to pick us up & claimed they were there. Well ok I said.. The next day we took the shuttle downtown again & made sure we called 15 mins ahead of time & well it was almost 2 hours before they came to get us. I called several time to complain the desk people claimed that the shuttle was there 3 times to get us but as I explained we were at the shuttle pickup & they never did show up. The front desk people just argued with us about it. We checked out on July 21st Check out was easy & quick. We would stay again due to the great deal we got. I asked to receive a call back from the general manager and still haven't heard back from him/her yet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at the Holiday Inn Superdome!”
Reviews.Author: thepals5
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed at this hotel for 4 days. Our first day in we met Ms. Patrice and Ms. Brandy and they were both wonderful and extremely helpful. We had the great pleasure of eating at the streetcar restaurant that is located within the hotel. There is a waitress there that you HAVE to ask for. Her name is Denika Joseph. Her service was excellent. She was VERY attentive and friendly. She even remembered our drink choices when we ate breakfast there on the last day of our vacation. We could tell that she truly has a desire to serve others because it showed. Oh, I should definitely not forget to mention that the food was great and children 12 and under eat free!

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOSTED OUR FIRST ANNUAL BAYOU SOUL WRITER'S CONFERENCE AND IT WAS FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: bayousoul
Reviews.Content: Everything was great! Trudy Guidroz helped us get good rates on hotel rooms and was always friendly and helpful. And Melissa Mahoney worked out our menu and room rentals. Both of these ladies were professional and dynamic and made our overall experience wonderful! All of our guests who attended the conference provided surveys and thought the food was great, the hospitality was superb and the hotel looked very nice overall. We are definitely coming back next year during 4th of July Week to host our writer's conference!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service from the Managers to the front desk to the catering staff”
Reviews.Author: smokesimmons
Reviews.Content: It's almost a week later and our phones are still ringing from family members saying how much they enjoyed their stay. Upon arrival, Shelly and Melissa greeted us in the lobby and proceeded to show us the layout and what to expect. Throughout the weekend if we had questions or concerns they immediately responded and resolve them. We also had mail sent to the hotel that we received once we checked in. Juanita at the front desk is not only a consummate professional but her knowledge about the surrounding area was crucial in our guest finding different locations to eat, shop, and have a good time. Juanita has the ability to simultaneously take on responsibilities at the front desk. Ralph Romero and Sam Carmant went above and beyond to ensure our hospitality room was constantly stocked with coffee, hot water and the condiments that accompany it. They set up our dining hall to perfection, it was done so elaborately that our guest took 30 mins taking pictures of the entire set up. Ralph even assisted our DJ with setting up his equipment and ensuring the sound system was working properly. He along with Sam ensured we never ran out of anything, or had to wait for anything to be refilled. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel, the service by the staff was excellent. I've traveled all over the world, from Europe to Korea to Alaska to several states in between, so I know great service when I receive it. I've suggested your Hotel and staff to all of my Soldiers that have been inquiring on a great place to stay, so you should be receiving more recently redeployed soldiers from Afghanistan. Thanks again for making our stay a pleasurable and memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly hotel near the central business district and the French quarter”
Reviews.Author: Ciahasher
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times, most recently during mardi Gras. It is about a ten minute walk to the French quarter, but very close to some of the parade routes. One advantage of the location is you are not trapped by a parade route if you arrive or depart (airport) when one is in progress. They have a great breakfast buffet and a pretty decent bar. They also have a pool if the weather is warm enough. Service is good. Rooms are fine and clean. Definitely good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: WestCoast_Peach
Reviews.Content: Pros: friendly check-in staff (Lucien), easy access to Canal, Bourbon and of course the Superdome, early check-in allowed CONS: I had to have my room changed THREE times over the duration of check-in. They placed me in a smoking rm the first time despite my request for non-smoking; moved me to another rm which was already occupied after that; third time's a charm I suppose. I had to lug my heavy bags back and forth to get this rectified each time. The accommodations themselves are meager to say the least. Although I never expect much from a 3-star hotel like Holiday Inn, I have stayed at better ones. The beds were comfy but the rooms are dated: old, smelly carpet, loud and dated A/C, "new" bath towels were musty, and heavy cigarette/marijuana smell on non-smoking floors. I'd swear the vanity mirror was going to fall off the bathroom wall, it kept making a heavy creaking noise. The shuttle was never on time, and did not drop off at all listed locations, which forced us to have to walk in the extreme humidity. Big deal but if you're going to have a shuttle service please accommodate your passengers and stop at the posted shuttle stops! All of these things could have been overlooked if not for the issue with my room charges. I reserved this room for $169/night through a conference special. Despite this, my account was charged $189/night, and they debited the full amount of the room from my card at check-in even though I had paid a night's deposit several months in advance. They have yet to credit back my deposit or the additional $20 per night that I was charged, and upon check-out they had the audacity to have an additional $700 balance due on my room! The desk agent wasn't helpful at all; he simply apologized and asked that I call back to have it "taken care of" after 9am. I never got a receipt, nor an explanation as to why my acct was overcharged TWICE. This is totally unacceptable and I will definitely be reporting them to the BBB. Stay at your own risk, I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is helpful and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: MatSciTeacher2
Reviews.Content: John, the concierge at the hotel, was extremely helpful on my last day. My suitcase would've been overweight for the airline so John found me a great box to use as a carry-on into which I transferred some of the weight. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great option for travelers”
Reviews.Author: oceanswell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a quick three day vacation. I love that the hotel is close enough to the French Quarter that we could walk to go out, but far enough away that we slept peacefully every night. The hotel was also close to the streetcar, which made exploring other parts of the city easy. The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable. Even with the parking fee, we paid less than $90 a night - an awesome price for the quality of the room and location. The only minor problem with my stay is that the service counter always seemed understaffed; however this really didn't affect my overall satisfaction with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and food.”
Reviews.Author: Rob_jc4
Reviews.Content: For the price of the rooms (150/night) and food (up to $20 per plate), would expect much more. Could have paid 20 bucks more a night and stayed somewhere much better. Staff seemed lazy and didn't really take their jobs that seriously. One night our French fries were all black and looked rotten. There was a conference in town so no choice but to stay there, but honestly it took away from our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: nlscroggins
Reviews.Content: First impression of this hotel was great, judging by the beautiful lobby. Our room was clean, staff was friendly, and the location is convenient- a 6 block walk puts you right in the French Quarter. We hit some snags in our stay, however. The elevator broke down between floors and we were trapped for about 10 minutes. Upon using the emergency phone inside the elevator, our call was transferred to about 5 different people, none of which seemed to know what to do or how to handle the situation. I assume this is because this rarely, if ever, happens. I guess we just got lucky :) Room service is also ridiculously overpriced and the food was cold and not very good when we got it, but there is a nice restaurant on site. Also, there was some construction going on in the pool area, so there was some extra noise/unavailability of the pool, but to the staff's credit, we were notified of this upon check-in. Also, beware of parking charges!! All in all it was a great experience, and I would definitely stay here again. Oh, and don't forget to check out the GIANT clarinet painted on the side of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JenMcCarthy23
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in April 2011. Our room was spacious and clean, with 2 double beds, extremely comfortable with a selection of pillows. Bathroom was also large. We had a view of the hotel swimming pool. The hotel restaraunt was very good and not too expensive, food was excellent! The hotel is a short walk from the main Canal St., Bourbon street area and also operates a free shuttle bus on the hour to the Bourbon Street area and to Harrah's casino. The staff are very friendly and willing to help. We booked our flights&hotel package through Expedia and got a very good deal. The other Holiday Inn is right on Bourbon street and the Downtown hotel provides a quiter alternative. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Average Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: YoungDiver
Reviews.Content: Just an average holiday inn. It was clean. Service just ok, in general service in NO is just ok. 5 minutes walk to Bourbon St.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, but clean; location a little sketchy for solo women travelers”
Reviews.Author: downtownresident
Reviews.Content: This hotel is indeed dated, with very old and shabby furniture, but if you look past that - and the slightly peeling wallpaper - it is very clean and comfortable. The linens are all nice and the pillows are great. The desk is not good for business travel, but I imagine most people staying at this place are not business travelers. The price was the most reasonable I could find, but the location was sketchy enough that I took a cab downtown and back for dinner at night, and one morning when I had to meet people at 6 a.m. to go to Grand Isle. By the way, the food I had the restaurant - crawfish linguini - was among of the best meals I've eaten in New Orleans, but the service was absolutely terrible.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: titina49
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the this hotel mainly because it had a pool. However, this was on renovation. I felt doomed about it. I don't understand why they wouldn't renovate it during the winter. Overall the hotel was good, service at the front desk was friendly with the exception from service at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A quick walk to the AMTRAK Station”
Reviews.Author: itsrobertsfault
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night during the layover between arriving on the Crescent Limited and leaving on the Sunset Limited the next day. It's an older facility that's been well maintained through the years and if you really really need to watch television during a stay in New Orleans you may end up with a 27 inch Phillips CRT plopped on the dresser which, in my opinion, if television is what you're going for in New Orleans you deserve. The room and bathroom were clean and, YES! more than one bar of soap. I love my friends, but when I travel with them I don't especially want to share the soap after they've used it to wash their butts! And I don't especially want to track down someone from house keeping to beg for a bar of soap. I'm a hotel guest not a prison inmate. The staff was professional, courteous, well informed, and helpful. The free WIFI was excellent. Remember to ask for the username and password when you check in. Sign on was easy and had my ipad connected to the net glitch free. Are you paying attention other Hotels with for fee WIFI. This is the twenty first century, charging for WIFI is like charging for local telephone calls, it's so nineteenth century. Breakfast in the full service restaurant was very good for the price, $15.11 including beverages and taxes. Don't order the room service veggie pizza unless you think to specify how much cheese you want. It arrived tout de suite via a cheerful and courteous young man, but I wish I though to tell them easy on the cheese. If you're traveling on AMTRAK the station is a quick and easy flat land walk to and from the station

Reviews.Title: “Good quality service at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Quise_11
Reviews.Content: Service was wonderful. Special thanks to the shuttle driver Matt for all of his help and advice on the surrounding venues.

Reviews.Title: “They have problems than can be avoided with planning.”
Reviews.Author: Valinor
Reviews.Content: First the Pros: Avg size room that is clean and comfortable. Great Bed. Old style TV with plenty of cable channels. Desk and chair for relaxing. Coffee maker. Bath was very clean and modern. We always had hot water. Good pool on the eighth floor with the fitness center. Most of the staff (floor, maintenance, concierge) were great. David (conceirge) was fantastic. We did not used the restaurant, bar or their internet connection. Now the Cons: If you use the free shuttle it only works outbound. We called for a pickup twice and they never showed. Once they nearly passed us by but my (athletic) wife ran them down in the street. We never had a pickup without issues. On the first night we were left on a street corner for 1 Â½ hours despite calling three times. We finally took a cab back. Take the shuttle oubound but take a cab back to the Hotel. A cab is about $10 from the French Quarter. You can walk it easily but I would not do it at night as there are some questionable charaters hanging around the corner at Canal St. The daytime is fine. This would be a soild 4 star Hotel but the front deskâ€™s failure to manage shuttle pick ups drops it to a weak 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “How to feel more comfortable walking to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: The_Wanderer52
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at the HI Downtown and walked almost everywhere (except to the Garden District) That's what the streetcars are for...(not allowed to call them "trolleys" here) To get to Canal Street and feel comfortable, walk out the back ground level parking lot, bear to the left and walk one or two blocks down Common Street and one block left to Canal. Pick up a streetcar in the center island for $1.25 and ask for a transfer (another quarter.) I think the first left off Common Street has Montel's Bistro...traditional 2 egg, meat, toast breakfast for $3.95. The hotel was great, We leave our do not disturb card up and they left us alone...Angie the bartender is great as mentioned. We kept losing our key cards and they kept replacing them. Business center is across the overhead drive but is safe and works well. Everyone was helpful and sociable. Only complaint is that the "free van service" to the Riverfront and French Quarter is limited to 11-12 people, leaves at the top of the hour only and early evening is so busy, not everyone can get aboard which means you wait 1 more hour and try to be first on. Pickup service call later in the evenings worked like a charm. BTW...forget your car...they charge $20 /night to park, breakfast is not free for all classes of rooms, transportation to airport is $33 for a couple by taxi...no airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Best out of town home feeling.”
Reviews.Author: Paree3582
Reviews.Content: My family and I were in new Orleans for my fathers bypass heart surgery. We were in a binde because we were having to sleep in the Wating room. We walked to the holiday inn downtown new Orleans and was greeted by Ms Patrice. I explained the situation and she said don't wory we will make it work for you. Ms Patrice felt like another mother to us. She was always asking us if we need anything. The rooms were awesome. The rooms were spotless. The cleaning crew came daily to vacuum and make the beds. They have a shuttle that leaves for downtown every hour on the hour. The restaurant and bar at the bottom served the best food. This was one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. Thanks Ms Patrice for making us feel like we were at home.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dennybaker
Reviews.Content: We were there on a Road Scholar trip for a week, and given the price of the rooms, we did not expect a lot. But there are murals of Old New Orleans all over the hotel and framed copies on the walls of the room - many are life size and could fool the eye, so you can hae your photo taken in front of one and become part of the scene. The breakfast buffet was abundant and delicioius, the staff were very friendly and nice.Theyrun a shtutle service to the French Quarter, theRiverfront and a couple of other spots. It is a bit hard to get a taxi there because it is not on the regular eaten track, but othewise we were extremely happy and would stay there again with pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded our expectations and conceigner Emmett steered us in all the right directions.”
Reviews.Author: gillisl
Reviews.Content: Listen to Emmett, we traveled throughout the city with ease and by providing shuttle service my sister and I felt very safe. The hotel is in excellent condition and staffing A-1. We understand it was one of the first to reopen after Katrina and only one that provides on-call shuttle service. Conveniently located near Amtrak which we took from California for our great sister's land-cruise

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff, and Location!”
Reviews.Author: regularpygmy
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed here over St. Patty's day and were quite pleased with the hotel. The staff, especially Ms. Donna, were amazing and helpful. We had a bad experience with room service, but after giving a note to the chef, he called us the next morning and gave us a free breakfast. Great customer service from this place. It's only a four or five block walk from the French Quarter. And there's a free shuttle that'll drop you for free at a few different locations around the city. The streetcar on St. Charles is only a few blocks away as well! And the hotel is happy to call a cab or airport shuttle for you, should you need one. The rooms are decent size for not being a suite. Beds are very comfortable. Most all have private balconies, though I wouldn't recommend the 8th floor if you're looking for a balcony, because the outside door opens up to the public pool area. Parking is expensive, though, something like $21/night. I'm glad we didn't rent a car... Overall, though, quite a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Some good, Some bad”
Reviews.Author: jwharris
Reviews.Content: Room rate good, Staff needs some customer service training. Room Service - Not a good idea. Breakfast - rotten bananas, burnt coffee, cold toast, not worth the charge (almost $30).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: Ridersavonlea
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to New Orleans so we chose this hotel as we were coming in by train and it was close to the train station, are we glad we did. The People were so friendly and helpful. John & Emmett were so good at helping us to find the best tour and always greeted you every time you came and went. They were happy to shuttle you to where we needed to go. We were there through Mardi Gras and a one night was very noisy with alarms going off. We called down and in no time the situation was handled. Very Professional. It wasn't too far from all the action or the street cars. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay”
Reviews.Author: wolfcorn
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here. Thought it was a decent room for a decent price. Nothing too fancy. We booked through Priceline and got the room for under a hundred bucks. The location was good, my 60+ mom and I were able to traverse the French Quarter that night on foot. The rooms were pretty clean, didnt really deal with the staff too much except at check in. Typical New Orleans attitude, but thats waht we expected, so no big deal. Parking was over 20 bucks a night, but it is in a multilvel garage, so I felt like the car was pretty safe (for New Orleans). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel, rude staff!!”
Reviews.Author: curlysue09
Reviews.Content: I brought my 3 children on a trip to the aquarium, and this hotel is pretty close to everything NOLA... the staff was almost standoffish and rude when asking questions about my bill. the first night our air went out, but maintenance came to fix it. Our shower didnt drain, however the rooms are clean and spacious..Parking is onsite, which we didn't need. The front desk was clueless when answering questions about my bill and trying to get a shuttle, which they advertise...overall, clean hotel, but pricey for the service i DIDNT get!!

Reviews.Title: “Never staying here again”
Reviews.Author: goflagsaints
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in the past, including after the LSU/UF 2009 football game, Mardi Gras 2010, on a trip to scout LSU and was satisfied with my stay each time. The rooms were not the cleanest, but they were certainly better than much of what you'll find outside of downtown New Orleans. I never asked for any concierge assistance during any of those stays. However! During my most recent stay (March 7-8) during Mardi Gras 2011 I was absolutely appalled at the treatment by the staff, condition of the room, and a general lack of interest in providing guest services. I understand it's towards the end of Mardi Gras and you're tired, but the treatment I received as a repeat customer was unacceptable. I called early on March 7th to find out if I could check in early, first I was hung up on by a an extremely rude and confrontational employee named Luscious (sp?). Then on my second call I had to convince the employee to take my phone number just in case the room opened early (seriously?). I booked a King suite which by no means should be a 5 star palace, but it shouldn't be of worse quality than the standard rooms I'd stayed in previously. The wallpaper was peeling off, the sliding door to the balcony didn't close all the way, and there was LESS space in the king suite than in a standard room (for over double the price!). Since I was going to a concert a few blocks away I called the front desk for assistance in hailing a cab for my travels (a reasonable request since they advertise in their handbook that they will call a cab for you) and twice I was told to just "Go hail one outside, they won't answer our call" (Keeping in mind that I did not witness them pick up a phone when I asked in person the second time and you would think a hotel would have more than one option of cab service). The next morning at breakfest we could not even get a refill on water from our obviously hostile waitress. I'm not a cheap guy, as evidenced by my gratuitous nature at Drago's and other fine New Orleans establishments, but this is the first time in my life I left a restaurant without tipping. My only advice after this experience is unless you are extremely desparate and don't plan on staying longer than a day, stay here. But if you are staying in New Orleans for longer than 24 hours, three words: avoid, avoid, avoid. If I could give the Service a zero rating I would.

Reviews.Title: “staff excellent, restaurant not so good”
Reviews.Author: houdinitedjuju
Reviews.Content: This is the one with the big clarinet: Staff were phenomenal; esp. Gloria (housekeeping), Wendell and Mr. Emmett. also front desk ladies. This was on mar 7 - 9th; very busy time. Everyone was very helpful. Loved this staff, couldn't have been better. Restaurant food not good. Eggs runny, son got a steak that tasted like a green olive-obviously rotten meat. and on March 9th, the restroom in the restaurant was filthy. (feces in every stall). But due to the staff, I will always stay at this hotel. Rooms are rooms and we can eat anywhere, but to have caring people like these to take care of you, well, that says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewYork1Teacher
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Holiday Inn on 2/20/11 for one night prior to our Carnival Triumph cruise. We had pre-paid for two room. One was ready but the other was not. (It was 2:45 pm) We took all our bags to the one room and it was beautiful. We had a balcony that overlooked a park. We missed the first free shuttle (they leave on the hour) and took the next to RiverWalk. Before we boarded one of the gentlemen gave us all beads for Marty Gras. Rode the ferry, ate at the Dry Dock Cafe and came back to walk around Canal street. We called for a pick-up to return to the hotel but we think the driver forgot us. We waited for 45 min. and called again. He came after another 15 min. (A little hard to keep 4 kids occupied waiting). We arrived back at the hotel, checked out the pool (very nice) and slept very well. Even though this hotel is near a hospital (and I'm a light sleeper) we only heard 1 ambulance all night. I would stay here again with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: BillG46135
Reviews.Content: I travelled with 164 friends and clients to New Orleans for a Carnival cruise. Most of our group stayed the night before at the Holiday Inn Downtown-Superdome. We were welcomed with smiles at check in. The hotel was beautiful and the rooms were outstanding. Judy and Melissa helped set up a dinner at the hotel the night before the cruise. They did a fantastic job. At the end of the cruise most of the group stayed a couple of days to see New Orleans. There were 143 people coming back to the hotel to pick up cars or to check back in. The front desk greeted us with smiles again and expedited the check in process. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Judy, Melissa, Patrice, Gary, John and Paul were the hotel staff that made our stay memorable. Thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras!!”
Reviews.Author: gumboisdelicious
Reviews.Content: I came to N'awlins to attend the very first Mardi Gras parade! All I could afford was the Holiday Inn just outside the French Quarter. The area was a little on the sketchy side, but I felt safe enough with my husband. When I checked into the hotel, Casey and Kevin and Brad were at the front desk. Brad checked me in, but Kevin and the other girl were very helpful with any area questions and telling us how to get to the parade and some other information about the French Quarter. We were not in the hotel very much, but what we saw was nice and the art added a nice touch. Hopefull we will be able to come back soon. Maybe next time we will take a cruise!

Reviews.Title: “Square dance group & cruise vacation”
Reviews.Author: Sue39604
Reviews.Content: The hotel & staff were really great -nice accomodations, helpful staff. 'Big" Paul White was super helpful and very friendly -don't loose him! We had a large group staying before and after our cruise -staff was very courteous made our stay so pleasant. Restaurant service was verrry slooow, even when not very full. -Needs improvement. Also, had several problems with the coded room cards not working well -needs better coding machine or system.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible banquet food”
Reviews.Author: runaround68
Reviews.Content: A group of some hundred of us ate at a banquet room at the hotel, and ALL the food was terrible: raw fillets, raw catfish, and raw chicken (really raw, as in indeible raw). I do not know of anyone who could eat the meal. I never saw so much wasted food in my life. Complaints fell on deaf ears; not one waiter offered, after practically being begged, to do anything about problems. They just took the plates away. The hotel itself was nice and the rest of the staff were cooperative. My suggestion: Do not ever attend a banquet. If you do, eat before you go--there won't be anything edible other than a small piece of pie. John Matthew

Reviews.Title: “Totally Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: ewrogers81
Reviews.Content: Feb. 13th and 14th, my family and I stayed at this hotel. We were there because my father was having brain surgery at Tulane. To tell the truth my wife and I were a bit scared to be in the heart of New Orleans. All we have ever heard is horror stories from the area. The stay at this hotel really put us at ease. When we arrived we were greeted by the smiling faces of Patrice Cooper, Kevin Sattler, and Brad Viet. Mrs. Cooper began to check us in and asked why were we the there. After telling her, you could tell she was empathetic to our situation. She and the other two gentle men went out of their way to ensure our stay was more than just comfortable. They made sure we had maps of the city, suggested kid friendly restaurants, and even gave us coupons to the zoo. They thought it would be a good idea to help keep the kids calm through our ordeal if we took them to the zoo. Boy were they right. My kids had a blast both at the zoo and the fine hotel. We will be back to New Orleans again, this time for a friendly visit, and we will surely be stay at the Holiday Inn Downtown Superdome! Thank you all so much!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience, Great parking deal for cruise”
Reviews.Author: virginiaMO
Reviews.Content: We had some hesitancy about staying here due to negative review. Our experience was great. Room very nice size, clean and well appointed. You can leave your car in their garage while on a cruise, saving us more than the price of the room. Free shuttle to the dock, but you have to reserve a seat. It was a $7 per person taxi ride back. Would certainly recommend this hotel for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Hardtoplease022
Reviews.Content: The customer service at this hotel was excellent. Juanita, Donna, and Shelly especially. Our group had some initial problems which were quickly sorted and fixed by this excellent staff. Any special requests or accomidations were taken care of at our request. Our group was very pleased with not only the appearance of the hotel, but the customer service. It was a pleasant experience to know that great customer service still exists. I would recommend this hotel to anyone needing accomidations for an event or for personal travel. Thanks Holiday Inn!!

Reviews.Title: “Great improvements being completed”
Reviews.Author: gwammy5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing some changes that will make a great place to stay even better. Rooms are being renovated and the new decor is beautiful.. The new chef is making some great changes to the menu. For those complaining about location or proximity to the Quarter, the hotel shuttle will get you to a number of areas quickly (quarter, WWII museum, Riverwalk, Casino). If you choose to walk to the quarter, use Gravier instead of Loyala until you get to Carondlet and you'll have a quieter route. I've walked alone during the day to Canal on Loyala and never had a problem with comments from those waiting for the bus. As noted by another reviewer, I would recommend walking in pairs in the evening. As in the past, a big strength of the hotel is the fantastic staff. From the front desk to the shuttle to the dining room, everyone is friendly and helpful. Kudos to all and special thanks to Patrice and Donna at the front desk, John for courteous & patience in handling shuttle passengers, and Javanna, Daneka and Alina for excellent restaurant service!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good food, and sinfully comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: tnredhead80
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here overnight but I felt completely pampered the entire time. The room was spotless, well furnished, and decorated with jazz/New Orleans related pictures. There was free internet access and the staff kindly assisted me with logging on. I opted for room service despite the expense and I was not disappointed in either the food or the serving staff (I highly recommend the California omelet for breakfast, it was delish!). I think the bed was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on, making much needed sleep impossible NOT to get. The hotel was pricier than places I would normally stay, but I felt it was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth your stay”
Reviews.Author: SRA091
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this particular hotel as it was centrally to business and pleasure alike. While parking is ample, you need to pay $22.40 per night, but it's secure and given the alternative of street parking over night with a boot, ticket or worse...pay the parking. The double room was clean, a good size for two people and a nicely equipped bathroom. The staff is very helpful, most of all Lucien, the day manager at the desk. He knows how best to get anywhere nearby and is one of the most gracious workers there, always willing to help. A free business center to check email is also included at no charge on-site. For the money, this hotel will gives the basics and then some for a quick stay on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, Terrible, Terrible”
Reviews.Author: BigEFortSmith
Reviews.Content: First off! We arrived at this hotel about 2 hours before check in and they were very rude. We asked if there was a room available and before checking to see, the lady at desk blurted out NO. We went to park our vehicle and even the parking attendant was very rude. After we parked, we went inside and there was a line of about 6 people who they were giving rooms too. This all happened in about 20 minutes from asking if we had a room available. I'm a platinum member and was treated very poorly. We finally get to our room and I was in disgust. This room looked like something you would get for $20 a night. There were 3 of us and they only left 3 towels. No wash cloths. The toilets sit very closely the floor and the bathroom is very small. The shower was stopped up the whole time which made showering gross. I couldn't even shower on the day we checked out because it was full of water from wife showering. If you get a double room, the beds are between a full and twin which again made it hard for 2 people to get a good nights rest. The tvs are old, the room stunk, actually the whole hotel stunk. We went to eat lunch at their restauraunt. They were out of just about everything, turkey, fries, muffaletta sandwiches and a few other things I can't remember. The food we did receive wasn't that bad but couldn't believe that on Sugar Bowl weekend they could be out of that much stuff and this was just the first day we were there. The location is close to the superdome but also close to Tulane hospital, which all you hear all night is sirens. It seemed like every 5 minutes an ambulance was leaving. If you walk to Boubon st, you have to pass a bus stop full of bums which beg for money or make comments about your wife. The parking is terrible also. I drive a GMC crew cab and couldn't get into most parking spots. They only let you park on 3-6 deck so parking during big venues is tough. I will go to New Orleans again because I did have a good time, but you can bet one thing, I will never pay to stay in this hotel ever again. Worst hotel by far I have ever stayed in! And if anyone from Hoilday Inn reads this. Ya'll need to do something with your customer service. These folks are the rudest people I've ever dealt with. I've stayed all over this country and have never been treated this poorly!!!!! And we paid $625 for 3 nights in this dump!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very successful trip”
Reviews.Author: cjm73
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel to attend the Sugar Bowl at the Superdome. I chose this hotel because of its proximity to the stadium and because of the low price compared to other hotels in the area. It did not disappoint!! The room was clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept in in a long time. The staff was friendly and helpful and the location, for my purposes, was perfect as it was equi-distant from the Superdome and the French Quarter (about a 5 minute walk to the dome; 10 minute walk to the French Quarter). The walk is safe in both directions; although, if walking to the French Quarter at night, bring a friend...it's just a good idea... There is a bar and restaurant adjacent to the lobby. The bar is quaint and comfortable, the bartender was extremely friendly and the food was good!! As far as my stay is concerned, I can't say enough good things!! Thank you Holiday Inn Superdome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing, would not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: jonijjeffj
Reviews.Content: The attittude and unfriendliness of the front desk and management staff override the barely adequate amentities at this hotel. We visited here with friends of out of state for the Sugar Bowl at the SuperDome. It was convenient to the dome but the hotel staff were untrained lacked "southern hospitiality". I was embarrassed and disappointed in the service and attitude at this hotel. We specifically requested a NON SMOKING room which had NEVER been a smoking room and were promised upon check in that this room was not nor ever had been a smoking room. Not only did the room smell of stall smoke but it had an ash tray and matches on the night stand. The front desk tried to overcharge our bill by charging us a higher rate than previously booked. They also charged us for the full stay and I had to prove that we had paid it upon booking. Luckily I had my confirmation receipt but did have to log onto my billing statement to confirm payment had been made. Will not be visiting this hotel again on our numerous trips to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent front desk staff, rude garage attendant and fowl smelling water”
Reviews.Author: Northshorelt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on December 11th. When I arrived by car there were no signs to indicate where to go for self parking. When I asked the garage attendant, they made a rude remark. When I checked in at the front desk I gave a credit card for the self parking charges only since I booked this room on priceline.com. When I received the bill the next day( which didn't even list my name) I saw the room charges on the statement. I went to front desk and specifically asked if the room charges were billed to my credit card since I prepaid for the room. The front desk person stated the charges were not billed to the card. I asked for another statement for just the parking and was given a statement with just self parking but with no name. When I reviewed my December Credit Card bill I discovered they had billed the room and did bill me twice for the room. Additionally, the water in the room smelled and tasted fowl. The hotel is not a leisurely walk to the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “GROSS”
Reviews.Author: jordanwhitley
Reviews.Content: Ick. At first glance it's not so bad. But then, ugh, my stomach turns every time I think about our room. Hallways reeked of cigarettes, as did our non-smoking room. The sliding glass door opened out to the pool and wasn't very secure. Very low ceilings, and a less than friendly front desk. Though the bartender was very nice. We ordered room service the next day, and it was vile. And the clientele wandering the hallways was shady at best. ICK!

Reviews.Title: “LOUD hotel, no customer service”
Reviews.Author: NMG1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so loud at night. All the we heard was sirens and music blasting from passing cars. We parked in the garage and they never gave us the "brown parking garage key". When we checked out, they girl at the front desk told us to pay cash for the parking but when we tried to leave the garage, the guy asked us for the brown key. We told him we had given the front desk clerk cash for the parking. After much hesitation, he let us out of the garage. It seemed like a scam. The rooms are older and could use updating. It wasn't that far from the French Quarter, easily walkable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 'Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: taylorFrankfort
Reviews.Content: This hotel website advertises In room safes, since we were traveling with valuables this was important to us. Our room had no safe, when questioning the desk staff, they argued several times that room 1210 had no safe, didn't want to go up and see for themselves just wanted to argue about it. We were forced to take one of their "plastice safe deposit boxes" at the desk. We load this plastic box with our valuables and leave to go to the French Quarter. The inevitable happens and we lose the key. We are told by Donna it will cost $200.00 to replace the key to this box to have access to our stuff. We argue this is unfair since we took the box due to their false advertising. We are willing to pay $50-60 but that its. She says she will leave a voice mail for the manager and he will call us the next day. Never does. we end up having to pay $150.00 to get this box opened. We never see the lock smith, never see a bill but are forced to pay this $150.00 to retrieve our stuff. We are moved to a room with a safe, but only after they had to have a maintenance man go to three different room to finally find one with a safe. So much for their website. Sunday brunch which is nothing special gets jacked up by $3.00 more due the Saints being in town, even the drinks at breakfast get increased by a $1.00. The waitress in their dining room couldn't smile or be friendly if it kill ed them The food is just average at best. The entire hotel staff seemed to have the attitude of don't give a damm. They advertise a jazz club in the hotel. If you call a bar with about 12 seats a jazz club. We will never stay at this place again. Linda and Dale Hart Kentucky

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: n1lrt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right around the corner from the Superdome, about a 4 block walk to the main Post Office, 6 to the Union Station & about a 15 minute walk to the French Quarter. The hotel shuttle stops & picks-up at the French Quarter, the Casino, Hospitals, the Riverwalk, the Convention Ctr., and the World War II Museum. The shuttle stops only at the cruise terminal but will not pick up. When I checked in, I made the mistake of taking the first room available which was 1515 & had a view of the back of the hotel. The confirmation said the view would be of the city. After several more room changes I was finally given 1723; the room had a view of the city (which the confirmation said), room for my laptop, refrigerator & microwave. I was told there are no restaurants nearby which is false. There are 2 Subway food shops about a 2 blocks walk each, an Italian restaurant less than 1 block away, several restaurants near Union & Baronne, just to name a few. Of note, there is a Walgreenâ€™s about a 2 block walk and a CVS on Canal St. about a 15 minute walk. It took me about 30-45 minutes to walk from the hotel to the Mississippi River, but I tend to take my time & view the surroundings. If you are going to eat at the hotel, eat in the bar area. The service is faster & you have 2 tvâ€™s to watch. The Hotel does not tell you everything. I am a priority member and should have been told at check-in that we are entitled to breakfast on the 18th floor for free. I found this out from the waitress while eating supper the 1st day I arrived. I was at the hotel during a home game held at the Superdrome. Although I was warned by others that the hotel would be hectic, it was not.

Reviews.Title: “Not much Service!!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy A
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is ver close to the Superdome there are some problems. First the staff at the front desk are not very friendly or helpful. It always seems like you are bothering them, from checkin to printing boarding passes or just asking area questions. If you are only going to the game this is a great location. If you are heading to Bourbon Street it is in walking distance but this side of Canal Street is not very safe. I would recommend a cab at about eight dollars each way. The room is fine and the food at the Hotel Restaurant just fine.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior75070
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days at this facility as it was very close to the customer's downtown office. I am a Platinum member and have spent 30 weeks on the road this year, all at Holiday Inn properties. Although I have had excellent treatment at all the hotels I have stayed in, this one set the bar to new heights. The staff treated me like a very special guest. The upgrade was more than I expected. Another nice feature is the Concierge Room on the top floor which is available to Priority Club members. They even upgraded my colleague, even though he is just starting his road warrior cycle. I thought that was a touch of class by the manager. Rates were reasonable for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: lrkauf
Reviews.Content: This was the closest hotel I could get to downtown as it was a spur of the moment trip. I am usually a fan of Holiday Inns however this was a terrible experience. I was unable to get an early check in because they were sold out the night before I can handle this but I work at a hotel and I know they at that time a day at least one room had to be available, but was told no with an attitude. When we were finally able to check in the room was not as nice as the picture on the internet, not to mention not clean. The lotion in the bathroom was half empty from the previous guest not to mention the wall paper was coming off, just not well maintained. On top of all this our door did not shut properly. We were actually walked in on by the housekeeper at a very inappropriate time because our door was not shut completely, not to mention she did not knock. All in all this was one of the most disappointing stays at a hotel that i have ever had, I would not recommend this hotel to any its too far from downtown and after a night on bourbon street i do not recommend walking back the that area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but expensive breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Malicette78
Reviews.Content: The staff is very helpful but the room service is quite slow. The swimming pool is very appreciated after a walking day in New-Orleans! Breakfast is very expensive; you would better buy food or have breakfast in a little cafÃ© in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: bransoncat
Reviews.Content: Booked online and got a great room for a good price. Parking a little expensive especially having two vehicles. Son had a large truck and unable to get in covered parking had to park in lot behind hotel and still had to pay parking garage rates. Our room was very clean and were able to get new towels, coffee etc. with no problem. Enjoyed the balcony. Enjoyed the fresh breeze and view at night. Daily shuttle was available to several attractions shuttle stopped at 10PM but taxi back was only $8 for six people. Unable to enjoy pool as several different church groups were there and pool overflowing with teenagers. Would recommend hotel do a Adults Only time slot such as 8-10PM so adults could enjoy a leisurley time in the pool. All in all we had a great time and hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Food in dining room was a little high but exceptional. Bourbon Street only a 10 minute walk away. Never bothered by any strangers on the streets.

Reviews.Title: “double billed room”
Reviews.Author: palms2grow
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn SuperDome in New Orleans collected twice for the same room, same night, same occupant. They charged my son's American Express and my Discover. True, anyone can make a mistake; but you'd rightfully expect it to be corrected. However, my letter to the hotel, complete with documented proof of the double charge, was totally ignored. The matter is now in the hands of my credit card. But be warned: There are many other beautiful hotels in New Orleans; you may want to try those, instead. I, for one, will not stay at ANY Holiday Inn ANYWHERE, thanks to this hassle. Incidentally, Holiday Inn SuperDome charged me $20 MORE than they did my son!!

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: Jason9549
Reviews.Content: There is absolutely nothing special about this hotel. The rooms still look like the 1970's and the only update are the beds and linens. Was nice to have a balcony but the sliding glass door leaked horribly and it never did get real cool in the room. I was on top floor and had a bad red ant problem. The parking is way overpriced $22/day. Other than that the hotel was clean, just very outdated. Oh and btw it is about 5-6 blocks away from french quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel. Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Travelista2009
Reviews.Content: Arrived around 6pm. There were 2 women working the desk. Both were very friendly and helpful. The hotel garage was easy access to the rooms and a great deal for in a city. Although the hotel wasnt in the best location the complimentary shuttle was awesome getting into the french quarter. The room was simply average. Not great but not bad either, however I enjoyed our balcony which overlooked the rooftop pool. Free internet was also a plus. Checkout was painless and they let us leave the car in their garage until 5PM no extra charge. I travel often and this was a decent value hotel. We will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be back”
Reviews.Author: Manteno
Reviews.Content: I tend to stay at Marriott brands, but have been staying at more Holiday Inns as they seem to be reviving the brand.and getting rid of their bad hotels. I was surprised by this property. I am a gold priority club member ( which means nothing to this hotel ). I get there around noon and being a member I hoped to check in early or earlier than normal. The guy at the desk told me my room was not quite ready to check back in an hour ( the manager yells from the other end of the desk -NOT UNTIL 3 o'clock. I then ask if there were towels and a restroom at the pool. I was told yes. I go up to the pool and of course no towels. I go back to the desk, stand in line again and this time get the front desk manager. I ask for a towel and am told " You are not allowed to use the pool until you check in" I was shocked. I told her I had never heard of such a thing and she shrugged her shoulders. I then asked to speak to the general manager. She replied " Sorry they are not on property". I then told her I was calling Holiday Inn Corporate and a room then seemed to appear out of nowhere. The room was ok. Minor renovations. The hairs in the bathroom were a bit gross. Not what I am seeing from this chain anymore. Then I leave that night and realize my door is not locking. I call down and they move me to another room at the end of the hall. I get there and it is very hot. An hour later it has not cooled a bit. The maintenance guy tells me that it is a corner room and never cools down. So they then move me back to the original room as the lock is now fixed. My final complaint is the parking fees. It was not as quoted. They say they can raise it for special events, but my car was about the only one in the garage so can not see what the special event would be. Also if you want to lay by the pool for sun, you lose it by about 1:30 in the afternoon due the position of the hotel. Finally the area. I did walk, but it is a bit scarey. The hotel is in an area of abandoned buildings. Probably should have taken the $8 taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Has to be better options for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Wisar
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs a major overhaul, the rooms are extremely dated, the wallpaper was peeling off the wall, the balcony door did not shut properly allowing in small bugs and taxing the air conditioning unit beyond its capabilities --- and we were on the Concierge level! The location is walkable from the French Quarter however the last few blocks are not in a great area and you feel extremely uncomfortable. The hotel does have a shuttle but you have to be willing to be tied to their departure times which seem vary depending on the driver. If you get a great price this hotel may be worth it, we did not and having seen all the choices in better locations I would certainly not choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, good accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: tulanegradmom
Reviews.Content: Our visit was for a graduation and the whole city was pretty well booked. The service was very good and the hotel was clean and comfortable. We were two women staying alone and we felt quite safe. The location is away from Canal St, but still convenient. The hotel provides shuttles, but we did not take advantage of the service. The beds were comfortable and we slept well. My only complaint was the high cost of parking.

Reviews.Title: “There are so many better hotels in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: LaGitana30
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was OK (executive level). Parking was around $23/day, and for this price, you have to park the car yourself!!! French Quarter is about a 20-30 minute from this hotel; there is a free shuttle traveling every hour and only up to 10 pm, so it is necessary to take a cab to return (or the streetcar on Canal Street then walk few blocks). Depressive atmosphere within the hotel, which seems to be frequented only by large elderly groups or business travelers on a budget. Will not recommend this hotel if you are looking for having a good time in New Orleans! Select an hotel closer to downtown. Sheraton and the Omni Hotel are both located a lot closer to the action!

Reviews.Title: “Quality”
Reviews.Author: AndiHaber
Reviews.Content: I went with the park and cruise package for 99.00. We didn't use the parking lot, but the shuttle took us to the cruise ship without a hitch! We stayed two nights. We had four rooms and an 8 year old with us. The rooms were beautiful! The breakfast was great! They had a rooftop pool that was heated. Anywhere you wanted to go, the shuttle basically took you close enough to your destination. My mom has walking problems, and we were worried, but it was great. The hotel consiere booked a tour for us. The only thing that sucked was the dinner. We never ate dinner there because the line was so long and it seemed like there were not enough servers. I was very pleased with the hotel! Not trashy, I would suggest not going out after dark unless you take the shuttle.They suggest several places to order in. I wouldn't suggest to my dog, the Half Moon River cafe. They were rude and it took an hour and half to deliver the food and it was cold and looked like it was sat on. The hotel was great though!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Attitudes”
Reviews.Author: blackbiter
Reviews.Content: Unhappiest , rudest employees I've seen in a long time, with two exceptions. Rooms are not upgraded, dirty carpet in hallways, holes in arms of chair in room. On their website, self parking is advertised at $10 per day. Actually you are charged just over $22.00 per day.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired but good value and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Fudge03
Reviews.Content: Not the smartest or brightest hotel ever, but one which could offer a reasonable deal during Mardi Gras so we were prepared to put up with the slight dinginess. It's true as is said in other reviews that it's not the pleasantest place to walk back to at night but it's OK if you choose your route carefully, and within 2 years there should be a new streetcar on Loyola which should solve the problem. A very ordinary hotel but one which serves its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel/Cruise Package”
Reviews.Author: TexasCatBird
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 adults (2 couples) stayed at the Holiday Inn Superdome before our NCL cruise on Jan 31st. The hotel is clean, in a good location with free hotel shuttle, and rooms are large plus nicely furnished. The downtown area is a bit noisy at night so you may hear noises through the balcony windows. Hotel staff especially Ashley at the front desk were great and always had a smile while helping us with our check-in and questions about getting around New Orleans (went to the WWII museum a short distance away). We booked the cruise package for less than $100 per night which included the one night stay and free parking for the duration of our week long cruise. Your vehicle is located in a secure garage with an attendant and key card entry/exit. You can take the hotel shuttle to the cruise pier but must take a taxi back tot he hotel. Enjoyed the HI Superdome's hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Superdome”
Reviews.Author: Serenity31
Reviews.Content: Got an insanely cheap package deal that INCLUDED flight and hotel for 4d/3nts for only $113. Yes you read right. So of course I jumped on it. Hotel is located in a quiet area very close to the superdome. Check-in was fast and I found the staff extremely friendly. The room was clean and basic. Hotel offers shuttle service to surrounding tourist destinations which I ended up not using because I didn't want to wait...plus I like to walk and explore. The French Quarter and Bourbon Street were walkable. Some of the immediate area of the hotel had some unsavory types just hanging around in the street, so if safety is a concern definitely take the shuttle, otherwise just take the same precautions that you would take in any big city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Ed D
Reviews.Content: It was my/our first time to this hotel as well as the city of New Orleans and I will definitely be back to both. We booked through Travelocity and stayed 01/29/10 to 02/01/10. This hotel was very near Interstate10 (about a half mile). The hotel was a ten minute walk to Canal and Bourbon streets, it was a five minute walk to the Superdome, and about a half hour walk from Jackson Square. Parking was $21.00 a day and you come and go as you wish with a swipe card for the gates. The area is like any major downtown area but we felt neither threatened or unsafe at any time. On occasion, people were hanging around the area but they didn't bother us. Just keep both eyes open and be smart. The hotel does provide a free shuttle on the hour to the French Quarter near N. Peters and Bienville streets. You need to call them to be picked up on the return trip however. Rooms begin on the 8th floor as the floors below are for the parking garage. The lobby of course is on the 1st floor. The outdoor pool was on the 8th floor which we did not use, be it cloudy and 40 degrees. The average high for New Orleans in January is 63. The fitness room was very small with an adequate treadmill and cycle machine. The weight machine was out of service during my stay. We did not use the lounge or restaurant either. The rooms were very clean and nice with all the amenities of the well-known hotel chains. An exception was the mini-fridge which was large and very cold. It even had a freezer section for ice cubes. The staff was very courteous and very helpful at all times. Rooms were expertly cleaned daily with new linens. I agree with 99% of the other reviews that this hotel is a great value with a great location. The other 1% can stay at the Ritz-Carlton, Taj Mahal, or whereever! All in all a great hotel and an enjoyable 3 day stay away from Massachusetts!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: LoulouQC
Reviews.Content: We were there for New Year's, which coincided with the Sugar Bowl. Even though our hotel was overrun with Cincinnati Bearcats fans, we enjoyed our stay. The location was great. It's a short walk to Canal St. and the French Quarter as well as to the Garden/Warehouse District. There's also a free shuttle to the French Quarter, which we made use of once. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Who Dat, Black and Gold to the Super Bowl! Thanks for a Great Stay - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jackew
Reviews.Content: Great Stay thanks! You going to the Dome this is the place to stay. Easy in and out, walki to the dome. Bourbon Street easy walk. Thanks for the great welcome and

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Bryan_2010
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a family-friendly hotel that was convenient to the Superdome, New Orleans Arena and the French Quarter. The Holiday Inn exceeded our expectations. We attended the Sugar Bowl and a Hornets game, both of which are an easy 10-minute walk from the hotel. The French Quarter is also within easy walking distance from the Holiday Inn. While the hotel provides a shuttle, we walked everywhere we went during our four-day stay. We never had to use our car, which made our trip more enjoyable. Employees at the hotel were friendly and helpful, and the rooms were clean and quiet. Expect to pay about $40-$50 more per night during the last three or four days of December due to the Sugar Bowl and New Year's activities. We paid $19 per day for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: SherryMississippi
Reviews.Content: This Trip was a great trip. The hotel Holiday Inn Downtown Superdome was excellent.. Shelly Dupry, our representative for our group at the hotel did an outstanding job. During the time of our stay, the cruise that we were going on, was pushed forward to a delay in the port of New orleans being closed. She graiously help us get another night stay at the same great rate. I would recommned this hotel to all my friends. Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “The Gross, the Dirty, and the Distasteful”
Reviews.Author: BlackberryPepper
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the price to stay and park for our cruise. The food in the restaurant was absolutely gross. We were severely mislead by the fantastic sounding menu board in the lobby, then when we were seated-- which took 20 minutes in a basically empty restaurant-- were handed a menu that resembled a fast-food or bar menu. Apparently they condense the fabulous menu to the cheap excuse for one when there is a game at the Superdome. When we asked about a few items, the waitress steered us away from them saying "It ain't all dat." Our food was terrible and itty bitty cold portions at that... no wonder the children eat free... they served my child a microwavable pizza. When we arrive at our room, we find hairs all over the bathroom: on the toilet, sink and bathtub. There was toothpaste and spit splatter on the faucet. My mother opened the drawer to show my son the Gideon Bible and found a tampon. The furniture appeared to have had violent cat fights occuring on it as it had holes in the arms of the chairs. Our balcony door didn't lock. In the morning they offer pastries and coffee in the lobby until 9:00. We arrived at 8:50 and had the coffee pots jerked out from in front of us while we were filling our cups. Now for the positives: The pillows were plump and the air conditioner provided nice background noise for sleeping. The cleaning lady cleaned our bathroom of all the hairs. We were comped a concierge breakfast for all of our "inconveniences" and given a partial refund. They took us and our luggage to the Port of New Orleans. When we arrived back to the hotel after our cruise, our vehicles were still there. The murals were nice. However, the bad and gross far outweigh the good and we will never return here. Disappointing, too because this was our first impression of New Orleans and it was a disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff make staying here a pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: gwammy5
Reviews.Content: Have stayed 3 times in the last 3 months on mini-vacations while husband is working in NOLA and each stay has been delightful. Rooms are clean and comfortable, staff is most accommodating in all instances, and the hotel shuttle has made it easy to get anywhere I want to explore. In most instances I walk back to the hotel and it is a short walk from most of the tourist areas, but if you want you can call for shuttle return service. The concierge room is staffed with courteous and knowledgeable staff and offers a light breakfast and late day snacks for frequent stay Priority Club members. On a number of rainy nights we've dined in the hotel restaurant and have enjoyed excellent meals that rival many of the restaurants in the city. Thank you HI Superdome staff for doing such a wonderful job!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: coolbangalorian
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with nice rooms. it is near to many destinations like french quater and convention center. The food was good at the restaurant. the rooms have a nice fell with good paintings and nice feel. The hotel also has good bus service for many location so that you can park your car and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “This Holiday Inn treats me just like I'm family.”
Reviews.Author: tigercajun
Reviews.Content: I can stay anywhere in New Orleans, but I prefer to stay at the Holiday Inn Downtown Superdome. The staff is incredibly attentive to my needs and goes out of their way to make me feel at home. There is a restuarant on site as well as a cozy lounge. With parking at a premium in New Orleans it is very convenient to be able to park on site and come and go easily. Located downtown, the hotel is convenient to everything New Orleans has to offer. This hotel is truely like a home away from home for me.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump....”
Reviews.Author: FurnMan
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Holiday Inn Superdome tonight and very surprised at the condition of the floor I am staying on. The carpets are dirty and the furniture in the room is worn out and pathetic looking. I would suggest going elsewhere if you want nice furnishings and better conditions for what is supposed to be a three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very stressful beginning!!!!”
Reviews.Author: venwil
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival of my honeymoon--after the airlines screwed up our flight and we missed our plane; we get to the hotel and there is no king size bed like we ordered and the double that we were given was not made up. After giving us another room (still a double) we were told that's all they had check back in a couple of days. (We were booked for 7 days!) Appx 10 minutes into the second room - reservations called and offered us a mini king size suite. It was really nice after two days of having ants.

Reviews.Title: “Superdome Holiday Inn and New Orleans Saints- a winning combination”
Reviews.Author: terrellb2
Reviews.Content: Great experience! Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly staff members who took care of all our questions and needs. Our room was clean and welcoming. The Sunday morning brunch is well priced and the food was excellent. The hotel is centrally located. It is close to the Superdome and the French Quarter making it easy to get around. They also provide transportion to several different stops. We will be return guests and have already booked our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay cash for parking”
Reviews.Author: dtoups
Reviews.Content: I prepaid when I made the reservations because I got a better rate. Upon check in, I paid cash for the parking at the front desk and was given a parking pass. When checking my credit card statement, I noticed a charge for parking. I called the hotel and was told that unless I had a receipt for parking the charge would stay. I was not given a receipt but since I was given a parking pass did not think that I needed one. So needless to say I paid twice for parking. I guess the girls at the front desk kept my cash...lesson learned. No complaints about the hotel...very convenient to Superdome and Arena.

Reviews.Title: “The Holiday Day Inn Superdome is super and so is their staff”
Reviews.Author: nawlinslove2go
Reviews.Content: This isn't the first time we've stayed at the H.I. Superdome and it won't be our last. They have upgraded most of their rooms with flat screen televisions and their outside pool is the largest in the Central Business District. Its proximity to the French Quarter makes it a convenient location to most every venue. They have free shuttle service to Harrah's and the French Quarter, although it is not too far to walk on your own. The chef came and met us at our table and the food was wonderful. Their bar is quaint with a friendly atmosphere where you can watch sports, eat some free Hors D Oeuvres in the afternoon and generally just have a good time. Their staff is friendly and it seemed that there was nothing they wouldn't do for you. We loved the in/out parking instead of valet. Your time and money are worth a lot here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Superdome with Free Shuttle to the French Quarter !”
Reviews.Author: minniepin
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel when I was looking for something near the Superdome with a pool...Keep in mind that lots of hotels in New O do NOT have pools and if you have two children and a wife that needs to keep her sun-tan, then this is a perfect hotel for you. We stayed on same floor as the pool which was perfect for the kids. The hotel has a complimentary breakfast, a complimentary shuttle to the French Quarter as well as garage parking in the building. The staff was great, with friendly management that were visable and willing to assist you w local restaurants, points of interest etc. It is a short walk to Canal Street and the French Quarter and all other points of interest. Would stay here again because of the nice size rooms and a place to park without the hassle and worries of looking all over the place for a spot where you will not be towed! Close to the Central Business District, Casino and Superdome Venues!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Weekend in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: kharrington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property with our two daughters (8 and 4). The experience was awesome from the word go.
