The staff was extremely helpful upon check in and our room was perfect when we got in. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel and the staff there was wonderful as well. The hostess even sat down and fed my four year old her carrots so that she could have ice cream for her dessert! We are very grateful to everyone at the property for making this trip a memorable one. My kids said they love the hotel and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: oothie
Reviews.Content: I thought all was great. It was easy to find and the all was great.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in NO!”
Reviews.Author: yellowrose53
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to stay in a suite which was beautifully, yet comfortably decorated. It was extremely clean. We visited the bar on Friday afternoon and had a great time meeting up with our group. Everyone on staff was friendly and accomodating. Hotel has a shuttle which helps so much. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: ezart34
Reviews.Content: Usually when I go to New Orleans I stay closer to the French Quarter, however this time, I elected to stay at the Holiday Inn, and for the first time in my many visits to this city I actually got a good nights sleep. It was very quiet, there was no hallway or outside noise or music to keep me awake after I had come in for the night. The staff was extremely friendly, and the hotel itself was very nice. It seems that they have just done some upgrades and the beds, and pillows were very comfortbale. The other thing that I was very impressed with was the covered parking, it was nice not to step back into my vehicle after it had been sitting in the sun all weekend. The biggest surprise was the quality of the food in the restaurant. I have never been a fan of hotel restaurant food until now, and will eat at this restaurant on every trip I make to NOLA from now on. I had the Shrimp and Grits and it was without a doubt the best meal I have ate in a restaurant in some time. The restaurant staff was very friendly, the service was great, very reasonably priced and no long waiting lines. I will definitely stay at this hotel on return visits to NOLA. The Superdome is close, and the French Quarter is a short walk or cab ride away, 2 thumbs up from me!

Reviews.Title: “The staff is very hospitable!”
Reviews.Author: GoGiants09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for anybody traveling to New Orleans. It is about 2-3 blocks away from the French Quarter but far away enough that you don't have to deal with all the hustle/bustle of the area at all times. It is also perfect for anybody who has any business at the Tulane Medical Campus as that it is right across the street. And of course, it is right next to the Superdome and New Orleans arena. The thing that really impressed me was how hospitable the staff was. They stopped me and asked me all about where I was from and what I was going to do in New Orleans. When I informed them that I was there to interview at Tulane, one of the staff members volunteered to drive me in the hotel shuttle so that I would not be late. I don't think I have ever had that degree of hospitality offered in such a spontaneous fashion.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff are awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: CTMToronto
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a monday afternoon and right away were greeted with a smile by the front desk staff and a sincere "welcome". The hotel is decorated with beautiful paintings and murals throughout with music playing in the lobby and elevators that will put you in the mood of New Orleans both old and new. The front desk staff and concierge recommended popular tours of the city and swamps, both a must see and do to appreciate the city's history and wildlife of the Bayou. The restaurant is graced with friendly, fast service and is very reasonably priced especially for a downtown hotel with a great breakfast menu. Our room had a King bed with a comfortable mattress, "duo" pillows for those who like them firm OR soft, flat screen TV with a balcony overlooking the outdoor pool which was refreshing to come back to after our daily excursions. Other amenities included mini frige, microwave, coffee maker all in excellent working order and great water pressure in the shower to boot. Thanks to all the staff for making our stay one worth repeating.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality Shines Through”
Reviews.Author: lynrd
Reviews.Content: We traveled to our church's national youth convention. Some 800 teens plus chaperones in this hotel and not one rude employee. We thought the location was excellent for walking to the Superdome, of course, but also less than a half hour to the convention center, and the French Quarter just around the corner, more or less. We journeyed out very little at night but always in groups of three or more. We felt safe and actually welcomed by citizens. The hotel staff bent over backwards to accomodate our early morning or late evening hours. Our "tourist-y" questions were answered politely and thoroughly. Should I return to NOLA, minus 36, 000 youth, I would book myself at this Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location, and lots of little issues that add up to a bad experience.”
Reviews.Author: aphexflip
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week long, and the whole time I wish I had picked somewhere else. The location sucks. The buildings surrounding the area are all falling apart., and it is just far enough away from canal st and bourbon st that makes you pissed off to walk there. Especially when you pass 2 other holiday inn's on the way. They shut the pool off for 3 out of the 6 days i was there, my keycard stopped working every other day, the plumming was turned off twice also. The rooms were nothing special, and have an older feel to them. Beds were nice, and so were the pillows. But I would never stay here again. Also I saw HD tv's in an ad for them, but all they have is crappy old tv's

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for me”
Reviews.Author: careau
Reviews.Content: I usually choose very budget accomodations so this was MUCH MUCH better than what I`m used to. Room was super clean, quiet and very well appointed - with a selection of pillows, fancy toiletries, hair dryer, iron etc. It was about a 10 minute walk from the French Quarter & Harrah`s on somewhat isolated streets with the occasional shady character. I was a solo female traveler and felt absolutely safe but could see how others might find the walk unsettling. In the morning I always took the free shuttle that departs every hour upon request. So-so pastries and coffee available for free in lobby every morning. Menu for restaurant looked good but I didn`t try. Pool was nice but water was somewhat opaque but nevertheless felt clean enough - nice gym too.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Amazing”
Reviews.Author: takenvacations
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay in this hotel again. I was on the 10th floor and the rooms were so clean and the view from the balcony was nice. Everybody at the hotel was very polite and I especially liked the painting of the clarinet on the side of the hotel. I would recomend this hotel to everybody solo traveler or a group of 20. The elevators were never crowded the lounge was nice. The pool could have been cleaner but I dont come to NOLA to swim in a pool. If you want to be close to everything this is a great hotel. I really enjoyed my stay and if I go back to NOLA I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Verrrry pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: FtlfFun4u
Reviews.Content: Spacious, newly refurbished, contemporary room with frig & micro; balcony too!

Reviews.Title: “Great place during our Jazz Fest 2008 visit”
Reviews.Author: KCluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several different NOLA hotels over the years - and this one provided a great experience. Hotel and rooms were very clean. Staff was welcoming. Shuttle van made transporation to/from French Quarter convenient. Highly recommended accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: skippie55
Reviews.Content: When i first walked into the lobby i was greeted by their wonderful and very friendly staff. They made you feel right at home . Checkin was fast, rooms very clean and a great view of New Orleans from the balcony. Parking was a breeze. It is great knowing your car is safe in their parking deck and parking for free, if you been to New Orleans you know how much parking can be staying somewhere else. We had breakfast the next morning downstairs. The staff greeted you and made sure we were taken care of. The food, well lets say you can always eat more than you should. While we were waiting for the others to come down, we notice the shuttle that was taking everyone to catch their cruise. Very helpful in everyway and making sure everyones luggage was taken care of and everyone was ready to go. We walked to the french corner instead of taking the shuttle that will take you free of charge. It's not a far walk, but some people may think it is. We were very happy and the short distance didn't bother us. Everytime we walked back into the hotel from being down in the French Quarters, again the staff was always glad to see us and wanted to know how day was. I give this location a very high rating, and i have stayed in other places in New Orleans. I RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not near anything”
Reviews.Author: Dave-LafayetteLA
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeously renovated 18-story hotel. The room was spacious. Bedding was very comfortable, and was complete with the latest trend of providing a variety of pillow types. Unusually, it had the bed turn 90 degrees to the usual orientation, with the head against the bath and the foot facing the windows. Maybe that's the reason I couldn't hear anything from any other room. There was a nice work desk with adequate wifi. I ate in the hotel's restaurant, and found the food good, having crab cakes for an appetizer and Shrimp Creole for the entre. The quality was entirely adequate for the business trip I was on, as I didn't have the time or energy to venture out anywhere. Self parking in the hotel. Staff was courteous, but I was somewhat aggravate by the fact that Priority Club perk coupons didn't arrive under my door until after I went to bed. How come they didn't give them to me at check-in? If you are in NO for city or court business, or are there for businesses along Poydras, this would be a suitable location. Obviously, it is a great location for Superdome or NO Arena events, as well. It would be a long walk to the Quarter or other tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: HJNDI
Reviews.Content: We spend a lot of time in New Orleans and have stayed at most of the popular hotels. Since our first stay at the Superdome Holiday Inn we were very satisfied. The staff ,at all levels have been great. The hotel is also very clean with excellent onsite parking. At the end of the day its really nice to have a great meal with a friendly wait staff to end your day!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and staff”
Reviews.Author: Shelbycruiser
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here prior to our cruiseon the Carnival Fantasy. We drove from Alabama and had no problem finding the hotel. The hotel has it's own parking garage, so parking was easy. We got there before check in, but were offered to leave our bags with the Concerige (locked up) and took the free shuttle to the French Quarter where we enjoyed lunch and a few adult beverages while watching the Super Bowl. We went back to the hotel at dark and had check in was a breeze. The nicest staff I have delt with in sometime. Our bags were brought to our room so we were ready for our evening. We went to the resturant and had the best gumbo I have tasted since our last trip to New Orleans. The next morning, we gathered in the lobby and caught the free shuttle to the cruise terminal. We had plans to spend the night we were docking, but my wife's 84 year old mother had been hospitalized the day before, so had to head home. We cancelled our night at the front desk since we had free parking to leave our vehicle while on the cruise. The staff were all so nice and wished us well so we headed home. We plan on making another trip to New Orleans and plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest place to stay in New Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: Topaz504
Reviews.Content: If you ever plan on visiting New Orleans the Holiday Inn Downtown Superdome is the place to stay. The location of the hotel to the attractions is the best. Although there is a shuttle, you are in walking distance to everything. The staff was wonderful! If I had to rate my total Holiday Inn experience on a scale of 1-10 they would get a 10+.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: cajunyank
Reviews.Content: Last minute French Quarter Festival plans found rooms to be a huge premium except for the HI Superdome, great rates, and parking on site. We used the free shuttle to go into the festival. Another plus is the heated swimming pool on the 8th floor. The restaurant got good reviews from those at the next table while we had drinks. The staff was helpful and really close to the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected find in New Orleans CBD!”
Reviews.Author: Dr_950A
Reviews.Content: As I was in New Orleans for business, this location was a perfect fit for me. I was able to walk to where I needed to be, leaving my car in the hotel covered parking lot, safe and sound, out of the weather and prying eyes. If I wanted to go to the French Quarter or the Riverwalk, there is the available shuttle . Very convenient. Quick check-in and check-out. Rooms were clean, spacious, comfortable and quiet. The restaurant has very good food. Best of all was dealing with the staff. Extremely nice, friendly and generous to a fault. Bent over backwards to help you with anything you needed. I will miss them.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Thibadeau
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located 2 blocks from my client's office so it's very convenient. It's also within walking disctance to the French Quarter and other great eating/drinking establishments downtown. The rooms offer the basic amenities but are clean. The food in the restaurant is surprisingly good for those nights when you feel like staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place today stay, but nothing to write home about.”
Reviews.Author: HappieSimone
Reviews.Content: We stayed here, because we got an awesome $60.00 a night deal. I don't think it would be worth it to pay the average $135.00 listed by tripadvisor. I'm not a huge fan of the business district, especially that far north. There was a lot of construction with closed sidewalks and buildings being torn down. The room itself was bizarrely laid out, but large and clean. The bed was comfortable. If you want to use the wireless, go ahead and get the card with the password at check in. Our cell phones didn't work in our rooms, and we weren't told in advance that we needed to leave a deposit even to call 1-800 numbers (my wallet was stolen and the no cell phone, no phone in room increased stress). The staff did let me use the front desk phone to call the credit card companies. We also had a bizarre night where it took 15 minutes to get on an elevator due to some sort of bible convention all arriving at the same time, but I can't imagine that happens very often. The biggest perk was the roof top pool. I had it all to myself in the early mornings. So, over all, nothing terribly wrong with the hotel or overly fantastic. If you get a deal, I'd recommend it. Next time I'll probably stay in a B&B on the other side of the French Quarter, where the best veggie eateries seem to be.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: mf72675
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because of all the good reviews on this site, and I have no idea what the fuss is about. The only nice things about this hotel are the shuttle service and the proximity to the Superdome. The front desk staff was generally unpleasant, and on 2 occasions the hotel kitchen claimed to be closed more than 15 minutes prior to the end of scheduled room service hours. If you want a pizza you need to order before 9:30. Rooms are old-feeling, and the view to the north or east sides is downright depressing. Not a great area - if you're going to walk from here stick to Poydras. It's a 15 minute walk to the French Quarter. There was also a 24 hour period where there was no hot water. They claimed it happens every once and a while, and you just need to let the water run for a while. Apparently 30 minutes is not long enough. I did not enjoy the cold shower, and they offered no apology. I stayed 2 weeks and at the beginning of the second week they drained the pool and it was still not refilled 5 days later when I left. Too bad - the weather was amazing. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: don9093
Reviews.Content: A group of 16 stayed at the Holiday Inn Super Dome prior to a cruise, The staff was wonderful, they assisted us in every way possible. Found a place to take us for dinner, then drove us there and picked us up afterwards. The room was large, comfortable, and very restful. I can't praise the staff enough, the front desk, the bell staff, the servers at breakfast, everyone was very pleasant and helpful. We had the cruising in NO package and it was wonderful value. We stayed a night and got greatly reduced parking in a covered, secure garage while we were on the cruise. Higly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy with Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: SailboatMinnesota
Reviews.Content: We had many problems. The reservation was for a handicapped room. One grab bar does not constitute a handicapped accommodation in my book. The toilet either leaked or was sweating. The maid said she would call maintenance. Nothing changed. The fan in the bathroom was inadequate. The heater/cooler was so noisy we couldn't leave it on. I told the maid we needed clean towels, but they didn't have to change the sheets. They didn't even pull up the bedspread. I've never seen that before. We were not told that we would be billed in advance of arrival (we wanted to split the cost on our credit cards) or that a $250 hold would be put on my credit card. We were told there would be shuttle service, and didn't learn until we arrived that that shuttle service stopped at parade time. I am handicapped--this created problems.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine Service”
Reviews.Author: pjsubway
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay at the Holiday Inn for three days before taking a cruise with my family. The room was clean and quiet, the front desk friendly and efficient and the location was walking distance from the French Quarter, although the hotel shuttle was a convenient feature. I was happy with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “not too good”
Reviews.Author: trippin_it_up
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the Sugar Bowl. I picked it strictly due to location as it is right by the Superdome. The experience was not very good at all. Checking in was a lengthy, painful process, the and elevators were extremely slow. The worst part was the restaurant and shuttle service. You had to stand at the reception desk forever to get acknowledged even though there were plenty of empty tables. You had to request a drink and refills multiple times before you would get them, and the food was not all that great. The shuttle is supposed to leave on the hour every hour. We waited by an empty shuttle bus until 20 minutes past the hour along with about 25 people. The bus only holds 14, so the driver explained he would be back for the others in 15 minutes. Those of us who did get on got to listen to the driver complain the whole trip. The rooms were fine and the bar seemed OK. From what I can tell, they just need a little management to get service up to par and they may be OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sugar Bowl stay.”
Reviews.Author: ClintDEsq
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Superdome for the Sugar Bowl. The hotel was booked solid, but I was able to secure a good rate from my local AAA office, who booked a block of rooms for the game. The hotel had obviously been refurbished since Katrina. Everything was very clean and well-maintained. The bed was comfortable. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The breakfast buffet was standard fare, but tasted good. The hotel is situated to where the French Quarter is an easy walk (20 minutes), but far enough away to get some sleep. There is a great sandwich shop called The Store about 3 blocks down the street which is open for breakfast and lunch. The hotel is only a couple of blocks to the Superdome and Arena, so if you are in town for a game or concert, it would be an ideal place to stay. The only hiccup was trying to use the shuttle to go to the French Quarter took longer than walking, albeit because traffic was awful. Just something to think about during special events.

Reviews.Title: “Bayou Classic”
Reviews.Author: Casey007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the Bayou Classic weekend. The hotel was nice and clean but the room we stayed in was very small even though we had a king size bed. The carpet was old but it was clean. There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room. The toilet did not flush properly. You had to flush over and over for the toilet to clear. The complimentary breakfast was very scarce. All that was available for breakfast was juice, milk, cereal, coffee(not good), fruit and some stale bread. The restaurant downstairs was a bit pricey but I'm sure that is because of it's location in the city. The staff was very kind and friendly. The view from our balcony was not great because all we could see was the ruins from Hurricane Katrina. The bed was fabulous. The parking was pricey but it was very convenient. I would stay at this hotel again but they need to improve on their complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “nice friendly stay”
Reviews.Author: Larry in Pittsburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights and really enjoyed the staff and the facilities. Nice rooftop pool, great lounge with bar. Was on executive levels and it included breakfast and evening snacks. Shuttle was a great help as the hotel is abit away from center of French Quarter. You can walk to French Quarter but I wouldn't do so late night. Parking is expensive at $19 tax included. You can park in open lot just around corner for $5-10 based on day of week. Would go back again as the hotel rate was very reasonable and the staff seemed to really care. Good hotel restaurant. Nilitary police are still staying at this hotel, made family feel extra safe and they shared some amazing stories with us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aconnel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during Jazz Fest weekend, and I have to tell you it was perfectly acceptable. The double room was plenty big for the 4 of us (Adults) that shared the room - they even had 2 sinks, one in the restroom & one outside the restroom that helped speed up the process of the four of us getting ready to go out. It was about a 10 minute or so walk to Burbon Street, but with a group it didn't seem scary walking to or from the hotel at any hour. You know that when your coming to New Orleans, it's not to stay in the hotel and order room service - so the limited amount of time we spent in the room was fine. The beds were comfortable, and clean and we didn't have any problems at all with the hotel or it's staff. Our television remote wasn't working, and they brought a new one up right away, and we called to order more towels & they were timely in bringing them. Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rude & hostile management”
Reviews.Author: vicadvocate
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Superdome while in New Orleans for the V-Day 10th anniversary celebration. When trying to check in the hotel manager did not want to honor the price that was agree upon. When attempting to explain that we had confirmation numbers and a faxed verification we were told tough, the charge will be $50 extra per night. We were told a complaint number and that we would not be allowed to use the hotel telephone. After 30 minutes on the cell phone while standing on the sidewalk outside we were allowed to check in at our price. About an hour after settling into our room the manager called to get the complaint case number and called me a liar!!! Other staff were helpful and obviously embarassed. Beware of management!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Lolirs
Reviews.Content: We came to New Orleans for the Mardi Gras Marathon on Feb. 24, and this was one of the closest hotels to the Start/Finish at the Superdome. We were a little concerned after seeing some of the reviews here, but decided to take the risk. We're very glad we did. The room was not palatial, but was certainly large enough for the two of us. It was clean, comfortable, and *quiet*. We were on the 10th floor of the hotel and had a view of the patio and pool, which is on the eighth floor. The National Guard is still helping police New Orleans at this time, and the Guardsmen are billeted at this hotel. We saw quite a few Guardsmen in the halls, elevators and lobby. Made us feel quite secure. One of the employees quipped that we were staying at "the safest hotel in New Orleans". :-) The staff was cheerful and helpful. Most everyone has a Katrina story to tell. Their stories are amazing, inspirational, and heartbreaking. We asked if it was wise to walk from the hotel to the riverfront, and were told that its safe to walk around most anywhere downtown. We did a lot of walking between the hotel and the riverfront and didn't have any problems at all. This was my first ever trip to New Orleans, and I hope that I may someday get to go back. What a great place to visit! Everyone we met made us feel that they were glad we came.

Reviews.Title: “People are marvelous!”
Reviews.Author: Idreamof
Reviews.Content: The people working at the Holiday Inn Superdome are among the finest hotel people I have ever encountered, travelling in all 50 states and Canada. They are very friendly and will do whatever it takes to make your stay great. I had booked a non-smoking room, but when I entered it, it reeked of stale smoke! I caught a maid servicing the room next door and she came over and gave a quick spritz of air freshner before I had to leave for a meeting. I then reported it to the front desk, who asked if I wanted moved. Since I had already unpacked, I did not, but Patrice and Brian at the front desk said they would take care of it and wash the walls. When I returned a few hours later, the room smelled fresh as a daisy! And it stayed that way the rest of my stay, so they didn't do just a quick fix. It appears they changed the bedspread, shampooed the carpets, as well as washed the walls to rid the room of the smoke. The shuttle drivers, Emmett and David, are just as nice and provide the only free shuttle service of any hotel in New Orleans. As a female travelling alone on this trip, they provided a valuable service so I could got out for the evening and not worry about feeling safe or having to wait for a cab. I feel Holiday Inn should have all their employees rotate thru this hotel to learn how to service their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for the NCAA's March 2007”
Reviews.Author: hehateme
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay. We booked this due to the fact it is the closest operating Motel nearest to the Superdome-Arena. All in all a nice place to stay. The Restaurant was good, and the service was good also in the restaurant. The bar was also good, and the bloody mary's were spicy. While we were there the National Guard was staying there, so safety was NEVER a concern. We did alot of walking to the Arena, and to the French Qt. Saftey was not a concern there either. It was sad to see in the limited areas that we were in the destruction that was caused by Katrina, and like mentioned above we didnt wander far from those 2 areas. Downtown Business District and the French Qt.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: JSmith75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in Dec 2006. Room on a concierge floor which I think means they are spacious? It was ok but nothing special. Clean tough and quite comfortable. Parking cost us $35 for 2 days!! Front desk staff were awful, very surly and unfriendly. Don't know whether it was because we were foreign visitors but they were so rude. Really wanted to get behind the desk and show them how to deal with customers properly. They have the Army staying here (200 of them) so it can be very busy and lots of comings and goings. Security officers man the hotel 24/7. Don't go out walking after dark unless you know the area. The bus driver was friendly and gave us some good tips. One of the security guards was also very helpful and gave us some good advise on trips to take etc. Not somewhere I would want to stay again but haven't got any complaints about my stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK experience”
Reviews.Author: bactman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week following Katrina for business. The overall stay was average, nothing outstanding. Pros: -Large, spacious rooms. Especially on the top floors (concierge level, I think). I enjoyed the balcony overlooking City Hall and the ongoing work at the Superdome. -Access to I-10 -Staff was pleasant to deal with. Cons: -The walk back from Bourbon Street at night (or even early evening) is a bit sketchy. There is about a 3-4 block area of DMZ. -The breakfast staff were understaffed when I was there, and the overall quality of food was ok. -Mold growth was observed in the room behind the vinyl wall covering. The wall covering was peeling off the wall and had been stapled in a futile attempt to keep it from falling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for Mardi Gras from 2/27 through 3/1. We arrived at the hotel at noon and was told check-in time was a firm 3pm. The hotel was gracious in watching our bags while we went and had some lunch at Frankie & Johnny's. We arrivied back to the hotel at around 4:30pm. The check in was smooth. Room # 1129, which had a view of the front of the hotel(Loyoal Ave.). I must say I found the room to be bigger than what I had imagined and it was very clean. The next morning while showering, the water in the tub wasn't draining. I called the front desk and the immeiately sent up a maintenance person and the problem was fixed within a half hour. There is a bar in the hotel which stays open until 11pm. I was told from hotel staff that the flood waters were only within the lobby area but there were no signs of water damage anywhere. This was my 8th trip to New Orleans and first since the flood. I expected to see a city in total disarray. What I saw was the complete opposite. There was no change in the quarter/downtown area. However the Mardi Gras crowd was a bit smaller than past celebrations. In my opinion many people were frightened away because of all the negative attention given by the media. There was a heavy police presence which made me feel much safer than my prior visits to New Orleans. The people of New Orleans were friendly as usual. Vito Palazzo Staten Island, NY Moladibari2002@aol.com

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Downtown Superdome
HotelInfo.Address: 330 Loyola Avenue, New Orleans, LA 70112
